Reviews.Title: “Terrible at managing problems”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over St. Patricks day weekend, a Saturday into a Sunday. The main reason I was staying at this hotel was because we wanted to go to the parade on Sunday, and wake up close and not have to fight traffic. Sunday we were to check out, go to the parade, and then check into another hotel to then continue touring Boston. The majority of my bad review is due to the properties lack of ability to managing problems in the hotel. I understand that I checked into this hotel on St. Patricks day (read: party) weekend, but this is no reason for me to expect that parties would be allowed in guest rooms. I stayed on the 9th floor, and down the hall maybe two doors was a significant party happening. People in and out of the room all night, into 5am. Very loud. Called down to front desk to explain the problem, to be told that they would take care of the situation. This was certainly not something they took care of. Neither of us slept very much all night, making the parade something neither of us wanted to do in the morning. Because of this, we skipped it and continued to our next destination for sleep, even though the parade was the reason we stayed at this hotel. You check into a hotel like The W in an effort to get a good nights sleep. It's an upscale hotel, not a Motel 6, you expect more from them in terms on responsiveness to problems. Additionally, the bathroom set up is a mess. I've stayed in plenty of hotels with "open concept" bathrooms, but this hotel really misses the mark. There is no way to turn on the light in the closed toilet without turning on a light that is visible from the bedroom area. This means when someone gets up to use the restroom in the middle of the night, they virtually have to turn on a light in the bedroom to do so. If sleep is important to you, I'd think about looking elsewhere. Anyone can give you a good nights sleep when everything goes right, but when something goes wrong you want a hotel that takes care of the problems. W missed this mark.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place”
Reviews.Author: Natasha M
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 1 pm and our room wasn't ready till about 4 pm. Not a big deal, we left our luggage at the hotel and went sightseeing. Great location, many restaurants and shops within walking distance. Hotels staff is very helpful and friendly. We were offered complimentary drinks at their bar/lounge which got really busy later in the day. Room was a bit too dark, typical W atmosphere. The most comfortable bed!! Cool place, highly recommend it if you travel with friends or solo, not so much for families with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!!”
Reviews.Author: Taryn B
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the W Boston with some friends. I have never taken the time to review a hotel before but the outstanding service I recieved from the W staff, especially Jenn Boucher (concierge) deserves to be recognized. Our rooms were awesome to say the least. Being unfamiliar with the city, we relied on Jenn's advice. Not only did she make us feel like we were old friends, she made sure we knew all the right places to have a good time! Jenn suggested we try Limoncello Restaurant which we did. We thanked her and told her what a lovely restaurant it was. I left without telling her that we ate there twice because it was sooo good! Our stay was so perfect that we are already planning our next stay at W Boston and we owe it all to the staff! I would highly recomend W Boston.Everyone we came in contact with was so nice and helpful. Thank you W Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Typical W experience...this time in Boston”
Reviews.Author: floricuse
Reviews.Content: Used points for one night stay with the Mrs. The W is certainly a departure from Boston's typical, stuffy (boring) hotels. Room was large and well appointed...definitely more room than I've had at other Ws. Real star of the show was the lounge in the lobby, particularly after dinner. Arrived after dinner in the Theatre District to a long line entering the hotel...people dressed to the nines...definitely more club than hotel at that point. Good news, the noise of the party didn't filter to upstairs. Good choice overall...just leave the kids and the grandparents at home.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: potrero71
Reviews.Content: A couple days prior to my arrival the concierge (aka "W Insider") sent me a proactive email asking if there was anything she could do to make my stay more enjoyable. In fact... "please make sure the room is quiet. I'm arriving late, I have very important meetings in the a.m., and I really need my sleep." Not only did they set me up with a fantastic setting, but 5 minutes after I arrived in my room, there was a knock at the door with hot herbal tea and ear plugs (which were never needed). THAT'S what I'm taking about! I'm Starwood platinum, and I travel frequently for business and pleasure. The Boston W stands out among the best globally.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff and Fabulous Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Caitlyn S
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late as my husband and I stayed in October. I booked using points and notified the hotel that I was celebrating my Husbands last "half" birthday in his twenties. The hotel went above and beyond my expectations. From the stunning upgraded room, to the beautiful and delicious birthday cake, the W Boston, specifically Elaine Goldman, made my husband so thrilled that he never wanted to leave. He said no hotel room would ever live up to this one! We will most definitely return and I would highly recommend this hotel to any friend or colleague. Great location, great bar, fabulous rooms, and wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Loud”
Reviews.Author: betty1407
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W for a weekend because we usually love the W hotels. This one , however, was a disappointment. There seemed to be no noise insulation at all; we could hear sirens, partiers, jackhammers....you name it, and it all sounded like it was literally right outside our door. In addition, the "open" bathroom doesn't really work unless everyone is getting up and ready at the same time. If one person is showering, drying their hair, even going to the bathroom, everyone in the room hears. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; typical W treatment; pricey extras”
Reviews.Author: JoeHouston52
Reviews.Content: Theatre district; 10-minute ride from Logan. Only 2 years old so in great shape. Room was large and well equipped. Although on 6th floor quite a bit of street noise (lots of late night partying). Wi-Fi was $15/day and bottled water was $7 - ouch. Overnight parking was $30 so we should have rented our car when we were headed out of Boston for our next stop. Staff was VERY friendly and "happy". A well run place.

Reviews.Title: “Bost'on's best for a reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: traveler54Maine
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights February 10 -12th. Really nice hotel with modern amenities, great designs in room, comfortable beds, terrific views of Boston. Walking distance to all, i.e. the Commons, TF Changs restaurant, Newbury Street....yet priced for only 179 dollars per night. Ultimate in service....friendly desk staff, great doorman, parking is expensive so park at the Commons and walk to hotel after you checkin......loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Fun weekend getaway.”
Reviews.Author: Kinna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend. We found the location to be convenient and the hotel is very clean. It seems smaller than most W hotels, it has a bit of a boutique hotel feel. We received good service while we were there. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good reflection of the Starwood Brand”
Reviews.Author: SASSSSY
Reviews.Content: This place might be great for a 20 something (crazy loud music when we checked in, bar flooded with party goers). And maybe it is my fault for booking at the W since I am probably not the demographic they are after (I am in my 30's). The W tries hard to be trendy but it is all flash and no substance. Our room looked just like an Aloft or Element - both Aloft and Element are great but that is because you get what you pay for...no frills but clean with Ikea decor. The pros: Location is great! Very close to a lot of the sights and great places to eat. The Cons: Our bathroom was dirty (especially the toilet seat...gross!!), our internet connection (which you have to pay for) was spotty at best, and they tried to charge me for a 1-800 call despite the front desk telling me it was free. When I brought it to the woman at the front desk's attention she tried to challenge me. It was not the $2.00 that I cared about rather the misinformation followed by the challenge. These aren't "end of the world" complaints (well maybe the toilet) but when you add them all up it is enough to make you think, "I won't book here again" - particularly with all the choices in Boston. Lastly, we shared our frustrations with the woman at the front desk upon our departure. She had a completely vacant stare in her eyes and truly could have cared less. We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy, very clean!”
Reviews.Author: Mary W
Reviews.Content: We visited the W as part of a romantic little trip to the city. We were VERY impressed with how immaculately the place was taken care of. The lobby staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, fresh flowers filled the lobby, and our room was absolutely spotless! The location was perfect, as we wanted to have dinner in Chinatown (just down the street) and see the Blue Man Group, which was right around the corner from us. The room we stayed in was called a Cool Corner, which was also very neat. It was not your typical hotel room...very modern looking with interesting art features.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Weekend”
Reviews.Author: mgaddis011
Reviews.Content: The staff was a tremendous from the moment we arrived. Monica at the Welcome Desk was very helpful, warm and friendly. The hotel is spectacular and clean, very modern. The room was spacious and very comfortable. Jennifer, the concierge was very helpful with lots of great recommendations which just made our stay all that better. My wife and i will definitely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Get away weekend”
Reviews.Author: LEONEL R
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best customer service. From the Doormasters who first greet you as you walk in to the concierge. Everyone goes out of there way to make your stay warm and welcoming. The bar downstairs in a great hangout/pre-club spot. My lady and I stayed there for a weekend get away. We reveived a welcoming email from the concierge (Elena) who was awesome in getting the in's and outs of where to go and what to eat for he eveining. She and the rest of the staff were amazing in getting us reservations and even giving us vouchers for cab fare. Definitely gonna stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “B-day Stay”
Reviews.Author: Maureen L
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the W hotel was amazing! The room was so beautiful and the amenities were endless. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The W helped make my 30th birthday one to remember!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: eksq
Reviews.Content: I was contacted prior to arrival by the concierge (Elena) in case I needed any help with my stay. I responded that I was all set and had tickets to a concert nearby. I walked onto the room with the latest CD of Lenny Kravitz playing (who I was going to see). Later my friend and I received other pre show gifts. I have never had more customized attention! (I am a Gold star member so I am sure that helped) And the snacks and drinks in the bar are very tasty, and so is the breakfast...... Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great three night stay at the W”
Reviews.Author: hotski7
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the W while attending a nearby conference. I emailed the hotel at 10:00 AM, once I arrived in Boston and when I showed up less than an hour later I snagged my room keys from the bellman. Great service! Had a nice but small corner window room and enjoyed that. The gym was great and the business centre very handy. I loved the free wifi in the lobby. And of course the lobby bar was happening, and the hotel resto (by Jean Georges) did not disappoint. Finally, I didn't check out until 2:30 pm on the Sunday as I had a 5pm flight, and the hotel took the news in stride. Only downside: noise from outside at 0200. Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pawel2354
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W Boston and was throughly impressed with the entire experience. From the courteous doormen to the helpful concierge, the process was very helpful and pleasant. My room was very modern and well thought-out. I would liken my room to a model house....very pristine and well organized. There were chargers for my Ipod and Blackeberry. Even though the bar area was relatively slow, the atmosphere was energetic. This is definitely the nicest W hotel that I have experienced. Even the hotel gym earns very high marks as it had many more amenities than most. If the rate was a bit more reasonable, I would stay here every time that I visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “The W was Wonderful........”
Reviews.Author: misscarlajeann
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W on January 14. It was a big weekend for me because I was turning 30 and wanted to go into Boston to celebrate with my friends. It was truly amazing!. The girl at the front desk, I believe the girl a the front desk was Lillian.....she was sooo helpful and nice....very accommodating staff. They even delivered cupcakes to the room for my birthday....what a nice surprise! I loved the W...it was my first time staying in one and cannot wait to go again! The location was great....so many places to walk to and loved the W lounge very cool atmosphere. Thank you so much again for the hospitality and I will definitely be back there again!

Reviews.Title: “What a "WOW" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: James P
Reviews.Content: Modern, Cool, Hip and by far the best Starwood Experience in Boston! I spend about 100 nights per year in a hotel. In fact, spent more time in hotels so far this year than at home! We were greeted by a smiling and helpful staff. Since it was a Sunday Night, and occupancy was probably not at its highest, (and being Gold Preferred does not hurt), we received an upgrade to a WOW suite. Everything about it was WOW! Plus, the front desk, knowing we were watching football, sent up a very nice snack for us. This was not expected and much appreciated. Upsides - Helpful front desk. They anticipate your needs. Rooms are hip, modern and have great showers and bathroom amenities. Workout room has very good equipment. Views from rooms are good. Convenient to theatre district, shopping, and Boston Common. Downsides - $ 46. for valet parking. You can park in lot across street if you want to save money. I will only stay at this hotel when I go to Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mwood86
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent area right in the Theater District. There are several good bars and restaurants to eat, including the hotel bar/lounge. I'm an SPG Gold member working on Platinum status, but I was extremely impressed when I was upgraded to the Extreme Wow Suite which is excellent in itself. Originally I had booked a corner suite with two queens, but they had sold out of them (Friday night). Had I had 4 people in the room it would have been a problem because there was only 1 King bed in the suite. They promptly brought up a roll-away bed when requested. Before my stay, I was contacted by Elena (W Insider) via email who left me an envelope for a few drink coupons in the hotel bars. This hotel exceeded my expectations, and I like the feel of having a direct contact with someone at the hotel should I need anything or have a problem. One criticism I do have though is that I called and asked Alaina at the front desk if the Suite was available for one extra night. She was supposed to call me back but never did, she left for the night. I had to call back and had the MOD look into it. All in all, no big deal and this is a modern, hip hotel with a nice feel to it. You won't regret booking a room at this hotel, I know this is the only one I'll stay at in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Windows rattled all night!”
Reviews.Author: shannon g
Reviews.Content: we couldnt sleep because of the noise. The windows rattled all night and we could hear everything (and everyone) in the hallway. When we told the concierge, she just said that the windows rattled because of the wind. It was almost as if she was incredulous that we brought it up. We were part of a group and everyone agreed...this hotel is over priced and uncomfortable. We left feeling unrested.

Reviews.Title: “cool !!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SAIMOHAN
Reviews.Content: modern cool and hip hotel . nice and large rooms . awesome location . will go back .

Reviews.Title: “May be Boston's coolest hotel venue.”
Reviews.Author: Slowhand54
Reviews.Content: Now admittedly we got a corporate rate that improved the value calculation but for style, attention and just plain cool atmosphere, W Boston takes top place. There are other places but they try a bit too hard;W makes it all seem so easy.

Reviews.Title: “Stylishly modern and somewhat inspiring to Boston's culture--dream maker!”
Reviews.Author: 1MSW
Reviews.Content: From the moment you walk in, you'll be taken aback by the impressive decor. The service that comes along with it creates a warm and welcoming feel. The room was spectacular and truly makes you feel like you've really travelled someplace wonderful, while still feeling "homey". I would certainly come back here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway! Never left the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LKLY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I needed a local night away from the kids, and we were pleased to spend it at the W Boston. We did not have to leave the building! The Bliss Spa is on the premises, where we both enjoyed treatments from fantastic therapists. The restaurant on property is Market by Jean Georges, where we had lunch, dinner and breakfast the next morning. Service all around was pleasant and accomodating. The rooms had all the amenities we needed, including snacks and iphone chargers! Due to the location, this is not a hotel where you should expect a fantasic view of the city, but it is close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: AgileScottie
Reviews.Content: Wow, love this place. So modern and clean. Room is very chic. Mini-bar has food I would actually eat. Restaurant was great. Nice flat panel TV and surprisingly a DVD player. Bar and meeting area is very nice too. Love the lighting and decor. Service very attentive. Best travel hotel I've been to in a while. Never going back to the Doubletree when I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Form NOT Function!”
Reviews.Author: nathan k
Reviews.Content: This hotel certainly isnt short on contemporay flair. Unfortantely, the designers didnt put any thought into function. Forget about sharing a double queen bedroom with friends or family. The bathroom wall is see through mesh! The room walls might as well be mesh too. You can hear a quiet conversation 50 feet down the hall and the couple two doors down having an intimate moment. We stayed on the tenth floor and we're kept all night with the street noise. The curtains are cheap thin plastic and do nothing to buffer sound that resonates through the glass exterior. You have to turn on the suite lights inorder to get the bathroom lights to work. The lights are also placed in odd locations, leaving wierd shadows or dark spots in the room/bathroom. I have stayed in rat holes and 5 star hotels around the country and in Boston. This is by far one of the worse locations. Especially considering the $$$ per night. Stay at the Boston Harbor Hotel, Taj or Four Seasons if you want a 5 star experience worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time - Staff too cool to service guests”
Reviews.Author: lisagallagher
Reviews.Content: The only good thing to say about the hotel was that the beds were incredibly comfortable. We didn't like the see-through bathroom which is a standard in the W Hotels, nor the fact that all amenities have a cost. Nothing in the room is complimentary and nothing in the lobby is complimentary. Not even coffee early in the morning. The hotel is dark, hip and very modern which is typical of the W Hotels but this one looked worn already. The lobby needs a facelift and there is nothing to eat while sitting on very uncomfortable couches without backs - just a bar. The only place to eat is Jean-Georges wonderful restaurant but had to go down the streeet for Starbucks in the morning. We stayed at the hotel for a wedding - they had blocked rooms otherwise we would have stayed elsewhere. On the morning we were to leave my 86 year old Aunt fell on the marbled bathroom floor outside the tub. The floors are like glass without mats and so she put a hand towel down but it slipped right from under her. She hit her head on the trash can on the way down and we had to go the emergency room of Tufts Medical Christmas eve morning. The hotel wouldnt let us use their car service but instead wanted to call for an ambulance to go 2 blocks. We declined the ambulance and asked them to drive us. They said no and that they would get us a taxi . They sent security to help us but they could do nothing but give us bandages to stop the bleeding long enough to get her dressed to go to the hospital. We got to the hospital ourselves and when we returned two hours and 10 stiches later NOT ONE PERSON asked us how My Aunt was doing or even acknowledged that anything had happened. Not the manager, desk staff, doorman, NO-ONE. In fact NO-ONE except security and someone from housekeeping even came to our room. NO-ONE acknowledged us in the lobby except security, The girls at the desk were too busy giggling and talking amongst themsleves. It was disgraceful. We have still not received an apology from the hotel for the incident. It is as if it never happened. They couldn't be bothered. In fact we had to call the front desk from the hospital to tell them if we needeed late checkout!! We paid for 3 rooms, 2 of them for two nights and we got absolutley no expression of concern or follow-up or apology from the manager of the hotel or any of the the staff except the security guard . When we returned they did not offer to help us with our luggage or bring anything down. We had to do it ourselves. They virtually ignored us! Seriously. The room still had the blood soaked towels on the bathroom floor! Terrible service, terribly insensitive people - NEVER GO THERE - EVER

Reviews.Title: “Trendy with great service!”
Reviews.Author: shredsurf
Reviews.Content: Very trendy hotel near everything. It's a bit pricey and the Marvelous suite on the 15th has a weird lay out (IMO). Next time we'll opt for a lower priced room. The bar was happening on Friday & Saturday nights. Conceirge - Jennifer and Josh were amazing...great recommendations and if you needed anything, they were there to help!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Fishabs
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying that this is a totally fine hotel. The staff was pleasant, the room was clean, the bedding was nice. But the room just seemed small and cheap. I could overlook the size of the room, if it had been nicely done. But the interior of the room was more like an Aloft than a W. This place has a very post-modern, minimalist kind of feel, but it comes off more as cheap and sort of depressing rather than high design. The bathrooms have a weird screen type of thing separating them from the rest of the room, so they are not really separate from the room. The lighting in the room is terrible; it's all floursecent panels build into the walls; i suppose it's supposed to be modern; but it ends up being pretty dark; hard to see when you're getting dressed; with a strange system of light switches all around the room. The walls are fairly thin. I can hear the person next door using the shower. There are no views to speak of it seems from any room, since I was "upgraded" to a room on a high floor (14 of 15), and all I see are the HVAC units on the roof of the building across the street. This is a fine hotel. But with all the choices in Boston, I would not rush back here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and spa if traveling solo!”
Reviews.Author: z2u
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel 3 times in the past 8 months. The lobby is nonexistent, as there's a restaurant that takes up the entire space. It's dimly lit, very modern and feels like you're walking into an office building. Once I stayed in a room facing the front of the bldg. This gets all the street noise, even on the 12th floor. Since then, I request the back--which is silent. The rooms are clean, modern and have very comfortable beds with fluffy duvets. The decor is gray and black, and the room's pretty dark, not a whole lot of lighting or sunlight. That's my only real negative--the room's kind of dreary. There are no views in either the front or back, as both face into buildings. Great Bliss products. Only odd thing, is that between the bedroom and the bathroom there is no full wall. There's a fabric panel separating them, like a window. No big deal, as I've been there on my own. However, if traveling with my kids, it would not be ideal. Room service is fast and delicious and Bliss Spa is in the building. Basically, between the comfy bed, really good room service and having Bliss spa to fill some free time--I'm a happy guest.

Reviews.Title: “W BOSTON Stay”
Reviews.Author: radhika b
Reviews.Content: I was visiting my sister in Boston. She had come in from the UK and I from Atlanta, GA. The Boston W was our meeting point. We had a wonderful stay because the hotel "insider" Elena Coronado helped us to plan our visit....that is which bars, restaurants and other hotspots we could not miss. She helped with our reservations and told us where to shop and which sights were a must. The hotel itself was fabulous, central, knowledgeable and friendly staff. The bar was buzzing in the evening and the spa was super. We would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Guest Service at W Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Molly I
Reviews.Content: My luggage was lost en route to Boston on a business trip last week. When I checked in at the W Boston and told Debbie Reidy at the front desk by situation, she jumped right into action to help me get everything that I needed for my next day of critical business meetings. She even personally went to the drug store for me so I could make my dinner meeting on time!!! She was fabulous and super responsive and nice! All the staff at W Boston from concierge, bellman, everyone are amazing and really go the extra step to take care of their guests. The property has a good vibe, comfortable beds, great Bliss Spa amenities in the rooms and a good location! I highly recommend it and thank you for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: JunianSH
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend in Boston at the W. The location is conveniently placed between downtown crossing (Macy's and others) and Newberry Road (upscale shopping). Everything is in walking distance. The staff was very friendly, competent and ready to walk the extra mile (coming from Europe we are not spoiled...) The design is nice and stylish, the room size is good and it feels cozy. We did enjoy the stay and will return

Reviews.Title: “One of the most memorable weekends ever- Thank you W Boston!”
Reviews.Author: pdarm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just celebrated our anniversary at the W Boston and we were BLOWN AWAY! Not only was the room gorgeous and their outlets fantastic (Bliss Spa, W Living Room, the Sweat, and a brand new underground lounge, Descent), but the service was outstanding. Everyone there went out of their way to make us feel so welcome on our special occasion, especially Jen L and Elaine. They have a top-notch team of talent who are clearly hospitality experts. Edison the Welcome Ambassador was fantastic as was Christa. Everyone was super friendly (in particular, Laura at the bar and the W Insider- I'm sorry, I forget her name). I can't say enough good things about them! We didn't get a chance to eat at their restaurant, the Market by Jean-Georges, but we will be sure to next time. We even used the W I-phone App to request turndown service, and, sure enough, by the time we got back from dinner our room was spotless. Thank you W Boston team for such a wonderful escape!

Reviews.Title: “Quite Expensive for 'Just Ok'”
Reviews.Author: Maddy122
Reviews.Content: We recently styaed one night at the W, after attending a private party at the hotel. The party planners and the staff were amazing but the room and the hotel are not as nice as others in the same area. The lobby is very small and underwhelming for the calibre of hotel. Most of the space is dominated by the bar/nightclub which was a zoo after dark. The check in desks seem like an afterthought, tucked in behind the club. The room was fine except for the lighting. The lighting in the bathroom was almost nonexistent and when we returned to the room after the party at 1am, only one of the bathroom lights came on. When we checked out, I was told that we were doing the lights "wrong" and that we must not have had the master switch on. That would have been impossible since the one dim light in the middle of bathroom came on, but none of the others. Anyway, the bed was comfy and the Bliss bath products are awesome but the hotel on the whole is just not worth the cost. If you're going to spend that kind of money in Boston, go around the corner to the Ritz or to the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Changed my entire opinion of the W - for the better!”
Reviews.Author: ExpeditionDaddy
Reviews.Content: I should start by saying I have not stayed in a W anywhere in the world for over 10 years after a disaster at the NYC W on Lexington during which a failed-to-be-made wake up call caused me to miss an international flight. I vowed I would never go back but decided for whatever reason that enough time had passed an I would give the chain another chance, and I am so glad that I did. From the moment I arrived I realized this was a top shelf property. Everything looks gleaming new, the staff is attentive and very friendly, check in was smooth and quick and the room was terrific. I stayed here for 5 nights (so it really was a ample test) and I just couldn't find fault with anything. The room was very intelligently designed (I stayed in a corner king). It was very large with a cleverly designed separate work area behind the bed which felt like a little office unto itself. There was a comfy sitting area in the sharp glass corner over looking the city and the extremely comfortable king bed faced two exposures of glass (basically all of the exterior walls of the room are floor to ceiling windows) so laying in bed you felt like you were in some multi-million dollar modern apartment in the sky; not bad! The bathroom was large with separate WC, shower and tub, nice amenities and good strong hot water. Ample closet space, excellent soundproofing, etc. Service was excellent. Room service was quick and the food was great every meal I had (incl. breakfast and dinner). The bar downstairs is hopping pretty much every night of the week but if you want to avoid it, just go to your nice quiet room. Finally, the location is very good. While it may not have certain things right out the door like you would if you were in the Back Bay or down town, you are pretty equidistant to everything so walking anywhere in the city is totally doable and easy. I loved this hotel and didn't want to leave. It is my new base in Boston and has completely restored my faith in W.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy + High Prices = Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiger02trip
Reviews.Content: The W brand tries very hard to be trendy, exclusive, an almost boutique experience and this property will meet your expectations if that is your goal. Yet, expect very high prices for all the extras - $46.00 Parking, $15.00 wired in-room internet access, $7.00 bottles of water, etc. And while the hotel rooms look sleek and modern, the construction was light on soundproofing. When I asked for a quiet room, the front desk clerk told me that on one side the hotel is bordered by a hospital on another it is bordered by construction which leaves the two sides which are on busy streets. At 7 floors up, it's noisy. Not to mention that I can totally hear the neighbors... The bathroom is nicely appointed. Bliss products and a walk-in shower (no tub). The room istelf is average size with room for a large desk and two small chairs. The views from the lower floors of the W are of other buildings, so don't expect to wake up looking at the Charles River. Service is basic for a full-service hotel. Late check-out for Starwood Gold and Platinum. The nearly $50 valet parking takes 15 minutes. The bar stays open late and the gym is open 24 hours. There is nothing remarkable about the W Boston. For $200+ per night there are plenty of other options in Boston that emphasize service and quality over trendiness.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite out of other Boston Starwood choices...”
Reviews.Author: casamarino
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the W for one night, this past weekend. Arrival & check-in were quick & easy. We headed up to our room (5th floor), put the key in and began to open the door - when someone in the room yelled "I'm busy!". Surprised... we shut the door and went back to the reception desk. Side note: Prior to our arrival - I had e-mailed the hotel (at their invitation) twice - asking for a low floor room and early check-in. I had not received a response by the time we arrived. I have done the same with the Westin and the Sheraton and always received a response. They gave us another room (12th floor), citing a computer glitch. They offered us two drink tickets at the bar and to credit our SPG account 1,000 points. The rooms are very nice - although I think they try too hard to be hip & trendy. There is an appearance of quality - but in reality, there are chinks in that armour... e.g. the towel hanger pulls out of the wall, the soap dishes in the shower are loose, the light switch on the lamp falls off.... small silly stuff, but a series of these things gives a sense of lack of quality. That being said - the BEST part about the room is the bed & the sheets. Super comfortable and cozy!!! No quality skimping there, which - in a hotel is critical, The room was very clean, as well. No complaints there. On other reviews I had read about the wierd bathroom - and I agree that is one area where the attempt to be hip & trendy went a bit too far. What wasn't clear to us from other reviews is that the toilet is actually separated from the shower & sink area by a door. Some of the reviews made it sound like there was no door - only a screen. We made use of the Acura Experience - which was super convenient and our driver was great! Upon returning to the hotel at night - we asked the bar for bottled water for our drink tickets - and were told that the two tickets only equaled one bottle of water?!? So, that's what we took - but it seemed really bizarre. The bar was packed at midnight - with a very young, noisy crowd. Check out is as 12, which is nice with the option of a 4PM late check-out for no additional fee - also a nice beefit - not sure if that is specific to Starwood members or not... The street/ambulance noise is real - but no different than many downtown hotels. The location is great for walking access to all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you would expect from a W”
Reviews.Author: CityPrep
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here a few weeks ago. It is everything one would expect from a W Hotel, clean, nice, trendy, and modern. The hotel is in a good location that is in walking distance to everything in the city of Boston. If you opt out of room service and have a Starwoods account then you get extra points added to the account. The mini-bar is insanely expensive - $8 for bottle of water. However, there is a 7-11 across the street where everything is ten times cheaper. The W does have their typical Bliss toiletries line, which my husband stated is the best shampoo he ever used in his life. The W is pricey if you paid for it out of your own pocket, but my husband's company paid for it so we were fine with that. The beds are comfortable. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: verdegallardo
Reviews.Content: Checked in got upgraded to a suite on the 12th floor as an SPG Plat (had to ask for it). The room was very nice! The staff there were extremely nice and helpful, especially Elana - she was awesome. A few things about this hotel -its ultra modern and well decorated. The business center and workout room are also great. -You can use the "Acura service" from the concierge free of charge to drive you somewhere. - It's noisy. The lobby at night time seems to turn into to a nightclub or something, so that's noisy, but also the road noise. I'm not sure if it's a fault of the hotel, the location, or just Boston in general - but expect to hear sirens and horns (almost all night), and people on the street screaming. Mind you we were on the 12th floor and still heard it all. - You have to show your room key before even entering the hotel at nighttime. The night of the snowstorm, they made me stand outside while looking for my room key. it wasn't until I almost shoved him out of my way so I could look for it in the warm lobby that he moved. Once inside it was music blasting and people everywhere, drinks in hand. Reminded me of a night club when I was 18. They should do away with this policy, for whatever reason they have it. - The location is great - near the public park and a starbucks/7-11, food court etc right across the street. Overall, it was a great stay. Had I not gotten any upgrade at all, I probably would be trying out another SPG property in Boston next time I'm in town. But with the upgrade and overal stay, I'll be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - with 'W' hotel style”
Reviews.Author: mark30121963
Reviews.Content: Visited Boston for the 1st time in October for a 4 day stay - we chose W Hotel off the back of previous vists to W Hotel's in other locations and we were not disappointed. The room was bright and airey with full facilities and usual 'W' Hotel touches - although charging $7 for water in the room was disappointing! The hotel is centrally located and in easy walking distance of most of what Boston has to offer - lively evening bar, good restaurant and generally helpful staff particularly the concierge! would stay again if in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “'Trend factor' kills the hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: D0nTravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel has very good things going for it like modern spaces, good restaurant (Market), pleasant front lobby Staff, but similar to other Ws I have visited in the past, the "trend" factor kills the hotel experience. In the evenings the small lobby bar gets completely packed with crowds of noisy people who come to the hotel to party. So forget about your night's sleep or using the lobby bar for a nice drink or some bar food.No space. You need to recluse yourself in your room and ask for room service (very limited menu). So you are a prisoner in your own room. A hotel with bouncers, need I say more? Location is very good, right in the Theater district, but that also means noise. Thursday and Friday nights were particularly bad around 2 am when the lines of people to get in and out the W lobby bar, were very very noisy, waking me up both nights. I was on a lower floor facing the main entrance, so I guess that other rooms will be less noisy. Front Staff very helpful but they have a problem with cleaning Staff. It appears that there is no supervision after rooms are made and they are not very thorough. The rooms are very modern with odd angles but I had all the amenities you could expect of an upgraded room, Bang& Olufssen CD/radio player, flat HD TV, Ipod and Bberry chargers and more. The bathroom is great with separate toilet room. Classy. The desk behind the bed is more a design excuse than a desk. It is so crowded you cannot even place your laptop on the desk. I guess the hotel is for trendy types more than business people, leisure rather than business. If you are looking to party in style, then this is your hotel, but if you are going for business there are better alternatives. Having said this I will probably return and try another type of room and see if I had a bad week with the crowd noise. The quality of the hotel deserves a second chance.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: judith94941
Reviews.Content: have stayed twice at this hotel, rooms are great, but the food is absolutely fantastic. try the salmon in black olive and passion fruit sauce. i travel all the time (platinum level), eat out a lot and am a foodie. this is great food.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: wharthog521
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at quite a few W's and generally am pleased with everything and am not a stickler/constant complainer. In my opinion, this hotel is average - not amazing but not horrible either. A few points: 1. We stayed in a corner room and it was obvious not much thought went into the functionality of the room - they have a main light switch by the door that controls the whole room/bathroom lighting (i.e. if someone is sleeping, you have to turn on all of the lights just to turn on the bathroom light; we even called the engineer just to make sure we weren't missing something). 2. They have two thermostats that do not remain in sync, thus it's very difficult to get the room to be the right temperature. 3. The rooms are LOUD since you are by the street. And I'm not talking about just kind of loud. There's a hospital across the street with CONSTANT ambulance noise. The staff is very nice though and the acura car experience is a nice perk.

Reviews.Title: “Ditto to "Embarassing" review of Jeremy M”
Reviews.Author: sheridanroad
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to their "Wow" Suite, which at 1st glance rated a "Wow". We went to sit in the living room of the suite when we returned from dinner. Both sofas had large and small stains in multiple locations. I don't know how they could have been overlooked. Housekeeping was called but they could not remove stains. Management offered to change our suite but at that point we had unpacked, were tired, and declined. We confined ourselves to the bedroom and avoided the living room during our stay. Management offered a complimentary breakfast and went out of their way to compensate for this disappointment. However, there was really no excuse for this bad housekeeping. Hotel would rate four or five stars if not for this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and fun weekend!”
Reviews.Author: LizCincinnatiOH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great weekend at the W Boston! It was a great location in the city, even though it was a long shuttle ride to the convention center. The room was very hip and well-appointed, and the staff members were very polite and accomodating. I was a little surprised to find a staff member hanging out on the fitness room equipment watching TV, but I think it was simply because I was the only person in the fitness room at the time. I also received the wrong bill under my door, but it was remedied quickly. I do see the challenge of balancing the tasks of being a loud, trendy nightspot and of accomodating guests who are coming back to rest after a night out. The downstairs lounge was definitely popular, but the key access in the elevator made the upstairs rooms a nice refuge. I enjoyed our stay and look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Embarrassing”
Reviews.Author: Sweetplums
Reviews.Content: I take certain pride in being a Starwood platinum guest, and I assumed the W Boston would be the same way. I checked in with my wife and they upgraded us to a spectacular king with wonderful stains on the bedspread. We ordered room service the first night, the menu had like 5 options, but the food was delicious, I'll admit that, especially the fries. We walked back Halloween night when the Nor'easter hit Boston and asked the doorman to enter, he literally made us wait outside in the sleet until we could find our room key. 3 minutes later, when we produced our room key, we were granted access to the Mecca that is the W Boston, covered in sleet. Besides the fries, this hotel has no legs to stand on. - platinum Starwood guest

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: fruitbat100
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights last week the room was very clean and comfortable, and all the staff were so good , especially the doormen, and Jen the concierge was fantastic at sorting out anything we needed. would certainly not hesitate staying again so central, the Duck tour was great fun too as was a night in little Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rmsnickers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on SPG points Sat and Sun the 15th/16th of Oct. Arrived early in morning and dropped bags off at front desk. Returned in late afternoon/eve to get room keys and was informed of room upgrade. Room was classic W (modern, clean, spacious) and all staff were helpful and professional. Upon check out, left bags with front desk staff while wife and I walked over to Beacon Hill for a couple of hours. Returned back to W to retrieve bags and was going to take a taxi over to the Lennox in Back Bay for another couple of days; W staff (Paul) offered us a ride in the complimentary Acura shuttle. Very happy with my stay at the W and it blew away the couple days I stayed at the Lennox; highly recommend any traveler give the W a try. Location was easy to get to Boston Commons, Orange line (and easy walking distance to other T lines), Beacon Hill, etc. In terms of style and service, W hotel and staff were outstanding. Couldn't ask for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “First time stay, will definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: upupandawayNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on business and was exceptionally pleased. Front desk staff were friendly and rooms were perfect for working late night. Beds were extra comfy after working an extra long night. Most of all however, was how accommodating and helpful the management and staff were in fulfilling our individual requests, even before we were guests at the hotel. Had called around to other hotels in the area to get details on internet speeds and never received a call back or were shoveled off to voicemails that never got returned. Booked here specifically because the staff made every effort to answer our initial inquiries before we were guests. And after booking, they took care of our additional bandwith and production requests without making it feel like we were asking for something obnoxious. Thank you to Joe for helping us out! I'm in Boston only a few times a year for business, but we most definitely will be staying here again on the next trip. Thank you W hotel for making this trip easy!

Reviews.Title: “Standard W with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: STLSteward
Reviews.Content: I'm SPG gold, I appreciated that the staff went out of their way to accommodate (don't have to wait at avg SPG line to check in, they will have your key waiting outside) and this was a better free upgrade than most. See pics. Points well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Bad W - Better Choices in Boston”
Reviews.Author: wintertraveler05
Reviews.Content: Reserved a room here for a very special night. Concierge and check-in was smooth and friendly. The room was average size with an Ikea modern look. I've stayed in Hilton's with larger rooms. I'm not a big fan of modern design because I think most of it is not user friendly. My first issue when entering the room was the lighting. It is just weird. Fluorescent and awful. Two light switches by the door, one turns on the bathroom light AND the room lights, the other is the hall light. It took us 4 hours in the room before we finally discovered that we didn't need to walk over to the room door to turn on/shut the light off in the room. There is a hidden switch beside the bed. I say hidden because it is painted BLACK, the same color as the BLACK WALL! And it is about 18 inches off the floor so you can turn it on/off while laying in bed. Next, the wall between the bathroom and bed area is just a see-through screen. So if someone is in the bathroom with the light on you can see everything from the bed. The lighting by the bathroom sink is terrible. It was impossible to see to shave. The bathroom is beautiful and it was nice to have the toilet in its on room with a separate door, but there could be more countertop around the sink. If you want to use the internet wireless or wired it is $14.95 per day. Even in the lobby!! This is why I hate high-end hotels, once you are there they nickel and dime you to death. For nearly $400 a night can't they give you complimentary internet? The biggest issue at the W is the location. I don't care how convenient a hotel is if you can't get a good night's rest. We were woken up at 2am because there is a nightclub next door that emptied out into the street in front of the hotel. Drunk people screaming in the street and we must have heard at least 100 car horns. And we were on the 10th floor! It continued for a solid hour before we fell back to sleep. Then around 6:30-7am the door slamming starts. Between guests leaving their room and the housekeepers everyone lets their door go and their doors slam and rattles our entire room. This continued throughout the morning. This is one of the noisest hotels I've ever stayed in. I was happy to check out and would never consider staying here again. I told the rep at the check-out desk about the noise and she said it has been a problem. There are just too many other better choices in Boston, like the Ritz's or any in Back Bay with locations just as good. This hotel was still haunting me two days later as I received an email with my final bill and saw that nearly $30 in mini bar charges. We never touched anything in the mini bar (there's a 7 Eleven across the street which charges a 1/3 less). And they never mentioned there is a $46 charge per day for parking. Very excessive. I called to dispute the charges and they were removed all while the service rep told me this has been a problem! I wonder how many people just pay it and never know! And they never mentioned there is a $46 charge per day for parking. Very excessive.

Reviews.Title: “High Expectations Big Let Down”
Reviews.Author: kiki7
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the W hotel this October. I love Boston and have stayed there numerous times but I have ALWAYS wanted to stay at the W there. When booking the first thing you should be aware of is that though it is called the theatre district, and centrally located it is also right next door to a HOSPITAL! Which means that you will most likely be woken up by the sound of ambulances blazing on several nights during your stay. Weekened street traffic is VERY noisy, the windows are not sound proofed/double glazed b/c one can hear EVERYTHING going on down below. We were on the 11th floor, facing Stuart Street. When I asked the front desk about moving they said they would look after it but never got back to us despite our bags being packed and their best intentions. The staff at the front desk seems very accomodating and friendly w/ very little follow through! We were there for over a week, and I promise you I had less than two nights of good sleep despite numerous efforts and inquiries. The beds are comfortable, the room spacious and clean, though when I pulled the bathroom glass door closed there were smears and smudges on it from the previous occupants. Also, the bathroom in our room is configured with a false wall w/ art hanging over the opening, so if you are sharing, (if you are a light sleeper) one person cannot sleep while the other showers/dries hair etc b/c you do hear the noise. The conceirge was extremely helpful, they arranged the Acura service for our day out at Harvard and made other great suggestions. The room service and servers were lovely! The variety for dinner limited but good. The only meal that was a disappoointment was breakfast the day we were leaving. It was cold, and tastless. If you can get a room facing any other street I would assume the noise would not be an issue, and the hotel itself is stylish and modern, the amenities good, and the staff helpful for the most part. I would not stay again unless I was guaranteed a quiet room....a vacation is meant to allow you rest and relaxation. And the room price is comprable to nice hotels with equal amenities and much quieter rooms! I am utterly sad I did not enjoy my W experience more!

Reviews.Title: “A wow place to stay, very cool”
Reviews.Author: nigeltaylor11
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at a W. They upgraded us to a wow suite and it was definitely wow. Service was first class with everyone going the extra mile to make or stay prefect. The lounge has a fantastic buzz about it as folks just drop in for a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: TG1915
Reviews.Content: We had enough Starpoints to get a free room and it was amazing. The staff treated us like we were important and special. The room is out-of-control amazing - gorgeous views, plenty of space and comfort!

Reviews.Title: “stylish & modern in Boston”
Reviews.Author: missjenni
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend at the end of September - lovely, stylish hotel with delicious Bliss amenities. Used Starwood points, so can't offer opinion on value. I know the W beds are famous for their comfort but unfortunately the noise from Stuart street counteracts it. There are a lot of bars locally so it gets rather loud come 2.00 / 2.30 am. On top of that, Boston drivers also love to honk their horns. We were on the 10th floor and I still was woken up every night - bring earplugs. Not a dealbreaker, though.

Reviews.Title: “If you like great service...stay here!”
Reviews.Author: patricesamara
Reviews.Content: On a recent book tour, we stayed at the W Boston. Prior to arrival, we received several emails from the hotel management outlining the amenities provided by the hotel including the concierge services. We felt as though they really wanted us to stay there...a far cry from the indifference one usually feels when you walk into a hotel. This was helpful because many people were meeting us at the hotel during our stay and the public areas were very welcoming. The lounge and bar provided ample seating and the restaurant was a real winner. The W Boston is hip and trendy, yet the service cannot be beat. Our room was a welcome haven after a long, hard day of work...we loved everything about it! One consideration for certain travelers...the bathroom in room 1501 had an opaque screen instead of a wall which may not be to everyone's liking, especially if you are sharing the room (this may not be a feature of other rooms). I think W stands for WOW in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “W FAN”
Reviews.Author: mtlfamily4
Reviews.Content: Have been an SPG member for a long time and have grown to LOVE the W's...this one is clean and well appointed...Staff were very nice and went the extra mile in making us feel welcome...Rooms were clean BUT the LIGHTING was very very bad in the bathroom! I would have no problem staying at the W Boston it is in a GREAT AREA!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great - Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGirl14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with Starwood points so I can't speak too much to value. Rooms were fine, definitely annoying that the one light switched turned on all lights. Not good when one person has to get up in the middle of the night to use the W.C. The lighting in the entire room was terrible. I had to put makeup on by the window because there wasn't enough lighting. The hotel in general seemed to be run by a bunch of kids (as in, 20 year olds) - Service in general was decent but could have been a lot better considering my husband is a Platinum member. The 24 year old concierge gave us very low end, low rated restaurant recs which is pretty consistent with every other W concierge we have encountered - Not a good experience. This kid clearly never had a dinner over $50. When DINKS come in to your hotel, know that they have disposible income to spare and cater to them. If you don't know, then ask what price range they are looking for, its that simple. This hotel is extremely LOUD. We were on the 14th floor and we could still here everything on the street below - Know that this the theater district but also the clubbing district. Lots of late night traffic and music.

Reviews.Title: “The MOST Friendly Luxury Hotel in Beantown!”
Reviews.Author: BabaDas
Reviews.Content: I'm actually writing this Thank You letter from 30,000 feet from my Delta return flight while the feeling of my W Boston bliss still resonates strongly! I came in just for a few days to visit my Mother who recently came out of some rather serious back surgery. (she is recuperating excellently). This was my first visit to The W Boston and I was far far from disappointed as it lived up to the accolades my fellow Platinum friends that have stayed with you have shared with me. Perfect location on Stuart St, a beautiful sculptured glass sphere rising up against the back drop of the older buildings of the city. Truly breathtaking! The Wheel's Crew welcomed me as I arrived Friday afternoon. Sometimes I feel the Wheel's staff do not get the "props" they deserve as they are always the very first "impression" a Guest encounters upon arrival at a W Property. Lenny and Leonardo impressed me with their Boston cheer and exuberance! I felt very W-elcomed by their enthusiastic energy! Next, Jen at The Welcome Desk, checked me in with her youthful sweet warm charm. Bill that quality struck me the strongest throughout my stay. I do not make that statement lightly. Your Talent team - everyone that I encountered, (from the Bar staff to House Keeping to the Doorman) had the most authentic kindness and candor. I felt every experience as a reflection of a true human dealing and not some "Role" they were playing. Everyone made direct eye contact, had a warm smile, and a kind exchange. That is unique to your Property. It's a direct effect of the fact that they so obviously LOVE the environment they work in and they take pride and respect in being part of your team. I'm not even kidding, I feel like I made some new friends! lol Your Concierge, was so down to earth and charismatic that my 74 year old Mother couldn't stop raving about her the whole weekend. They bonded together while we were hanging out in the front Lobby Saturday morning. Her name is Jennifer Boucher. I also want to recognize Frank Ibanez my In-room dining server. He was exceptional and spot on with excellent service! Growing up just outside of Boston in Newton, and attending Northeastern University, I have come to know Boston as my hometown. It makes sense that I truly felt "home" staying in your Properties "Blue-blood Bostonian" care! I promise I will do you justice with my W-ord of Mouth recommends to my fellow CEM/Plats!

Reviews.Title: “Hip & Chic”
Reviews.Author: Hotelsnobb
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here and were literally across the street from the theater we were going to. Great location for the whole theater district...you can walk anywhere. I was pleasantly surprised at how nice and friendly the staff was...not because they were just going through the motions, but they really seemed to sincerely love their jobs. From the doorman to check in to the Bliss spa and shop, everyone was very welcoming. The hotel is beautiful and super chic, unlike many of the prim & proper, slightly uptight, and very traditional hotels in Boston. Our room was wonderful...a bed so comfy it was hard to get out of in the morning, great Bliss toiletries, and fun stuff in the mini bar. Definitely recommend having a drink in the lounge at night and getting a service (or two) at the Bliss Spa. We live just outside of Boston and will definitely be back for another stay soon as well as a spa day.

Reviews.Title: “design flaws abound”
Reviews.Author: rosey1963Toronto
Reviews.Content: I'm a fan of the W hotel group, having stayed with them in a number of cities so on a recent trip to Boston it was a natural choice. As always, there is the groovy vibe when you arrive and lots of beautiful people and pretenders hanging out in the lobby bar so an instant party if you don't wish to venture far. The location is great, walking distnace to the common and in the midst of the theatre district. The room however had some significant issues. First off, the thermostat didn't work. The options that did work were either freezing cold AC on high or nothing, and then the system shut down completely during the night so we awoke in a sweltering room. The room lighting system requires the very large and bright neon wall light to be on at all times or there is NO light at all. Had to use a flashlight to find the bathroom in the dark. Hotel management had left us a message regarding the lighting so they clearly know there is an issue. Then there was the smelly, mildewy shower curtain. for the price, this hotel was a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: siburton
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights whilst on a city break. Hotel is in an excellent location and the location is by far and away the hotels best feature. It's a very funky modern hotel, Bliss products in the bathroom, plenty of towels and THE most comfortable bed! Service was a bit stand-offish. I think we were travelling at a particularly busy time, prices where quite high and I'm not sure the high price was entirely justified. But never the less we had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Epfeagles
Reviews.Content: It was an Excellent stay, Service was amazing, staff was helpful and polite and made excellent reccommendations for different things. Fantastic rooms that are spacious and comfortable with a Chic and Mordern twist. The lobby is a great place to relax and have a drink at the lobby hotel. All in All a great stay would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “2 weeks @ W Boston”
Reviews.Author: B-MfromVan
Reviews.Content: Our stay was booked from July 29th and onwards. Mom and two children (8yrs. old and 16yrs) travelled for a two week stay. Starwood member. The weekend of August 5-7th/2011 had to move to another Starwood hotel in Boston. The Whotel was overbooked that weekend. We returned for the continuation of our stay Whotel.. Amazing City and the community of Boston, very helpful & nice. Walking distance. The summer weather must make the city smile and sparkle with kindness. 7-11, CPK and Bank of America across the street for your convenience. Boston Common Park, movie theatre- one block away. Walking distance. Hotel provided our room with a Nintendo Wii!! Thank Goodness:) Clean rooms, modern clean decor, refrigerator available, bar, privacy respected. Free wireless internet hotel lobby (save $15.00 daily), no pool, bliss spa great for a quick mani-pedi!! The staff rocks as professionally trained, familiar with hotel guests and patrons, professional concierge, doormen (one employee had whistling skills, he'd flag your taxi for you without using a whistle- reminded me of a scene out of a movie!!, the bell men-nice communication, hotel security, hotel lobby at check in- warm personalities. WAIT. Last but not least...we had the convenience of utilizing the Whotel Boston complimentary Acura Car Service. It is truly a mom's dream to be whisked away to her destinations on a daily basis (kids). Acura service gave us complimentary Fiji bottled water and bliss facial wipes. Excellent * * * * * drivers Paul & Paul took care of me and my family. I'd go back just to be spoiled as a tourist!! Next year. Well managed hotel. Check it out. Family from Vancouver BC Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience in every way possible. Would highly recommend this property over any other hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Westondrive
Reviews.Content: I am a platinum Starwood member so I have stayed at plenty of W hotels across the country. The W Boston is no exception to the excellence this brand stands for. I was given a free upgrading to a lovely and spacious room. Everything from the front desk to room service was perfect. I can go on and on about all the details that other hotels wish they could claim. This is one of the finest W's that I stayed at, plus make sure to sign up for the Spg loyalty program. Stay at this hotel and see why the W experience is like no other. Afterwards, please write your review.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: JMNV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W for five days, early in September. Great rooms, great location, excellent staff

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: toronta
Reviews.Content: Book this hotel with hotwire, got to hotel and I request 2 bed, they gave it to me right away, Room is nice and modern. I dont understand why people have problem with the art screen, it look lovey. We have bathtub but never used. my two thumb up go to the concierge service it SUPERB everything from book my Acura to getting my husband birthday cake to print out 20 page document to fax 10 page paper I cannot rave about it enough JENNIFER you rock.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, New, Safe, and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: velvetcoconut
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed only one night, we live close by and wanted a night out. We had a corner room that was quite large, very nice, clean, new and modern. The bathroom was very nice, granatie with a cool sink, but not very private. Lighting in the room was subtle and different, I really liked the lighting. Hotel is in a great location only a short walk to the Common, Fanual Hall, Aquarium, and is in the center of the Theater District. We stayed on a saturday night, I didn't get much sleep because we had a noisy neighbor with many friends and the street was super noisy, motorcycles, ambulances and loud pedestrians, until approx. 3am. We stayed on the 7th floor. If you like to stay up late, great otherwise I promise it does quiet down, eventually. We didn't dine in at the W, but we did eat across the street at Rock Bottom, that was a great choice. The staff was efficient, and very helpful, no vending machines on site. There is a Starbucks (opened late) and Dunkin across the streetl. We had a very nice stay and would reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Overall, a positive experience”
Reviews.Author: elemiee
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay at a Starwood hotel and picked the W mostly for its location and I was pleased with my choice. It is just blocks away from the Boston Common and subway stations, not to mention the great coffee shop, Thinking Cup. After reading reviews of the hotel, I was worried about noise and bathroom situation. The bathroom situation isn't ideal as the screen provides no privacy. Upon request, the hotel put up a privacy screen, which is pretty much a shower curtain. It solves the issue of seeing through to the bathroom from the bedroom area though it does not solve the issue of sound. I think the W Boston should seriously considering replacing the screen with an actual wall. As far as noise goes, yes it does get a little old when the near by theaters (more than one) but personally it did not bother me that much. We got upgraded to a corner room (Thanks SPG!) and it was quite spacious with a nice view. I do wish the bathroom is bigger than the regular rooms though. The gym was fairly small but has everything I needed for my workouts. All the hotel staff I have encountered was courteous and helpful. We did not get to experience the Acura Experience as it is always booked though the hotel offered to comp one of my taxi ride as the Acura was not available. Since this is my first stay at a W hotel, I can't say whether W Boston lives up to the W brand. Overall it was a good stay for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: mbsef2000
Reviews.Content: I found this W to be a great location and quality. The rooms, staff and common areas were all very nice. I was only here for one night however the standard room which I was in was vary spacious and well appointed. The staff was very friendly and kind, the car service was also a very great offering.

Reviews.Title: “nice location basic room”
Reviews.Author: q8engrchina
Reviews.Content: hotel was great location. just in theater area. and steps from park and New berry street. 7 eleven in next block. and you can walk any where in city. no Swiming pool and GYM is very small and basic. i think furniture budget was cut. Lobby in nice place to have a drunk and bust always. free car ride around city. try that. Conceraige is very helpful . .

Reviews.Title: “W was a great home away from home”
Reviews.Author: rodeo2244
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked into the W Boston after losing power in our home during Hurricane Irene. We live about 20 miles west of Boston and work in Boston, and had a feeling the power would be out for a few days. When I called the hotel to book a room, and the front desk manager heard why we were moving there, she gave us a deeply discounted rate to help out. The room was a Wonderful room, and extremely comfortable for both of us. We had a ball walking to work, dining at Market, going to a Red Sox/Yankee game, and jogging all over town after work every day. The hotel is in a great location, and the front desk staff asked us every day whether our power was back on. We were there for 3 nights, and consider it a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JLAA
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend at the W for the first time and loved it. We have stayed at several Boston hotels and this one is now at the top of our list. Clean, modern and fun. The room was great, modern furnishings, plenty of room and great amenities. The "screen" between the bedroom and bathroom is really cool. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Location is great, plenty of restaurants and bars in the immediate area. A short walk gets you to Newberry St. or the Prudential Center. Loved it, we will stay again anytime we travel to Boston without our kids.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Boston hotel”
Reviews.Author: Treycb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in town over night for a Red Sox game and we booked a room at the W through hotwire. It was a great pick. In a busy city, this hotel is on a main street with very easy front door service / access. The valet parking was superb ($44 per night). We didn't even have the ignition turned off and they were right there opening the door and welcoming us. The concierge was quick to call a cab for us ($8 ride to Fenway), and there was always someone holding the front door for you. Check in and out was very quick and employees very friendly. The room we originally booked had been oversold so they asked us if we minded taking the exact same room only 40 square feet smaller. In return we would get 2 breakfast coupons (worth $20 a piece) and 2 drinks at their lounge. We are also offered a late (4 pm) check-out without asking. We had no problem with that. The decor, as mentioned in other reviews, is very modern, but comfortable. Our "smaller" room was actually very roomy, and we didn't miss the 40 square feet. The bed, pillows and sheets were so soft and comfortable. The "infamous" screen is actually pretty cool - assuming you are not rooming with anyone other than a significant other. During the day you can just see shadows moving around, but it is definitely see through at night with the lights on in the bathroom. I really did like it, but out of curiosity, and because of all the reviews about it, I did ask if this screen was in every room. They said yes. HOWEVER, a privacy screen is available for those who require it. I do agree the lighting in the bathroom is a little dim. But nothing tragic. The shower was very roomy, the water just the right temperature, and the pressure just right. The whole room was immaculately clean. There is a nice selection in the (typically expensive) mini bar. And, I loved the fact there were cell phone cords available for just about every type of phone. We did have breakfast at Market (the hotel's restaurant). The food was on the expensive side but very good and of very good quality. My only complaint is our waitress, although attentive, seemed like she would rather be anywhere but there. Understandable, who wants to be working, but don't let your customer's see that. The only reason this hotel did not get a overall rating of 5 was because, for me, it was too noisy. There is typical city street noise, but for some reason it seemed, at times, extra loud. This was particularly the case when a police car or ambulance went by. However, the big thing was the hallway noise. You could hear doors slamming and people talking as they walked up and down the hall. Luckily we were towards the end the hall so it wasn't so bad. I couldn't imagine being in a room outside of the elevators. I was also not overly thrilled with the fact that a gentleman came to check the mini bar at 3:30. If check in is 3 pm, I feel like that should have been taken care of by that time. Despite that, we would definitely come back to stay here again. A couple of side notes...there are a few restaurants (including a Dunkin Donuts) right across the street and pets are allowed in this hotel. There is a charge for WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Modern sparkling with a glitch”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller10101
Reviews.Content: This is a very modern showoff hotel. We reserved two connecting rooms. The hotel has a very cold over modern atmosphere and decor. As other reviewers stated there is an issue with the bathrooms doors that are see-through and also the wall to the bedroom side is see-through. I don't really get it. It was annoying. The rooms are super clean large and sparkling. The location is on a busy street. The hotel is high-class modern and shining but not my cup of tea

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in Boston”
Reviews.Author: SwissTravelist
Reviews.Content: The "W" in Boston is nicely located in the city centre, close to shopping streets, restaurants and the like. Modern rooms, good room service. Also suitable for leisure stays (city trips)

Reviews.Title: “Noisy room, not worth the W label”
Reviews.Author: PSL3000
Reviews.Content: I booked an above-standard corner room on the 8th floor, which was so small it had barely enough space to walk around the kingsize bed. There's limited storage space. Illumination in bathroom is from sideways, rather bizarre and not practical. However, the hotel has a modern and clean look. There is no "W" charm, which was a disappointment. Major disadvantage: very noisy room from street side till late night in weekends, in spite of being on 8th floor. Clearly soundproofing was not a major concern in the hotel design. Breakfast was "a la carte" only, no buffet (unforgivable in this hotel class), and heavily overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: walesonvacation
Reviews.Content: I chose to book the W in Boston as a venue to host and surpirse my wife for or 15th Wedding Anniversary and a Private Dinner in the Market restaurant. From the moment we arrived to our departure the next morning, we were treated like royalty and the dinner in the private dining area in the restaurant was fabulous. The staff from Doorman, Front Desk to Alison in Market, our waitress and Alex Fisher from guest services made our stay a memorable one and impressed the 10 guest we invited for dinner- well done

Reviews.Title: “Completely Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: Morgan B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W for a family wedding and had 1/2 price rooms. At $200 a night I've had much better stays than at the W. The bathroom is behind a canvas screen (no privacy) and there was no light switch for the bathroom, which meant turning on the lights in the entire room in the middle of the night. The colors are depressing (gray/navy), the decor is basic IKEA fare, and don't expect a view in the lower rooms. The worst part of the entire stay is that they didn't clean the room unless we called down and asked for service. They also added insult to injury by charging us $17.50 for items on the snack bar that we never touched. Among the services they offer are rides to destinations around the city w/in 5 miles, but the service was unavailable whenever we asked about it. The hotel is definitely not worth the $$ even at 1/2 price.

Reviews.Title: “Why a W?”
Reviews.Author: annieket
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W for three days in July. Service is great & room (Mega corner) was perfect to stay with our kids. However... we cannot figure out why this hotel is part of the W hotel chain. We stay at W's frequently, the Boston W hotel has nothing groovy, hip, trendy and no unexpected design surprises. It gives the impression that after all the money was spent on the building (great), but that there was no money left to decorate the inside. The rooms are plain, the design of the hotel bar & entrance is boring. We just did not really understand how Starwood took this W in its group. There is nothing wrong with this hotel, but if you have W expectations, they will not be met. Bliss spa onsite is great.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect to sleep on weekends after 11pm”
Reviews.Author: Travelaroundoften
Reviews.Content: Typical W Hotel--great staff and service. Stayed in a "Cool Corner King" which is an upgrade. Nice room, with a few drawbacks. 1) Huge windows cover 2 walls and the curtains are nearly impossible to open and close--they should be remote controlled. Particularly the corner curtains as you have to stand on the furniture to close the blinds. 2) Lighting makes it difficult to use the shower, bathroom or toilet without illuminating the rooms. 3) Party scene inside and outside continues well beyond the time most bars close. A very drunk and loud street crowd were heard both weekend nights until 3am. Its a great hotel if you're in college. 4) Parking is $44 per night, which is the highest I've paid at a hotel, including 5-Star properties. Better off finding municipal parking nearby and walking to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected 1st class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hugh_C_11
Reviews.Content: I selected the W Hotel based on its proximity to Shear Madness alley,as my wife and I had theater tickets to that show. I wasnt willing to pay over $500 night to stay in the theater district but was willing to pay around $300. After doing some research on tripadvisor.com, and doing some pricing, the W Hotel seemed to be the place to stay, but still was a liitle hesitant because it was rated something like #37 out of 70 hotels in Boston. I booked it anyway, and all I can say is that we will never go anyplace else if we ever stay in Boston again. An easy drive to the intersection of Tremont and Stuart, we were greeted and directed immediately by the front door valet.
