When we checked in at the front counter, the young lady was overly friendly, very welcoming, and explained to us all the major ammenities the W offered us. And I loved this..you need to have access to a hotel key to use the elevator. I applauded the extra security as i found out later the lounge in the front of the hotel transforms into a late night bar where many non-guests have a drink at the bar. The rooms were beautiful. Clean,spacious, a long dresser counter, closet space, glass shower. Some negatives were very low output lighting, whats up with the alarm clock ??? (cant read the time), and the area around the toilet was a little cramped. Plenty of ample walk around room. One wierd "decoration" was the see thru screen between the bedroom and shower area. Now I enjoyed it, as I got to see my naked wife get out of the shower, but anyone traveling with kids may have to block this invisible wall with something. There was hookup available for WiFi, but we did not use. The king size bed was the most comfortable bed I had ever slept on. Too bad we needed to be up at 7:30. The location of the W is invaluable. Close to Boston Common, Chinatown, Theater district, Fanueil Hall, North End...everything was in walking distance or a short cab ride.We elected to have dinner accross the street at RockBottom but we did have room service breakfast. Very expensive ($25 omelette) and I'm still not sure if a service charge was added to the bill before I signed for a 20% tip. Overall, not the most expensive hotel in Boston, but it sure felt like it. My wife and I cant wait to have the opportunity to go back for another weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clsmit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W for 4th of July weekend for a wedding. The location is teriffic -- close to the Public Garden, Chinatown, Copley Plaza, and in the Theater District. We walked almost everywhere. Checking was easy. Our rooms were typical W -- clean lines, very hip. We ate breakfast in the hotel one morning. It's very expensive but good food. If you want something cheaper there's a Starbucks and a Dunkin Donuts across the street. The rooms are quiet. The beds are comfy -- the W bed from Starwood is a pillowtop bed that's fairly firm. In the evening the bar seemed to be hopping. The computers for checking email didn't seem to work when we tried them, so we didn't use them. I also couldn't get the computer in the lobby to print my boarding pass. Neither was a big deal, but if you needed to use these services I'm sure they would help you out at the front desk. Overall this was a great place to stay. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, nice position 44 $ for parking!!!”
Reviews.Author: RunningA
Reviews.Content: I've been there with my wife during our visit to Boston. It's a well positioned hotel nearby Beacon Hill and Charles street, Boston Common Park. It's a good place for both experiencing Boston visit and have some uwuied walks and run in the park. The hotel room is outstanding in terms of cleaness, infrstructures and space available. Very negative is the Parking cost (44$ a day). If you go there, remember that round the corner (stuard street vs. Charles street south) there is a public parking for only 20$ a day.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Jawkaz
Reviews.Content: Although after the experience of W hotel in Washington DC we realized that the W experience is almost a rip-off, but our reservation at the W Boston was already made. We went hoping it will be a better experience than DC but it was just the same: disappointing. We were very disappointed to go to a hotel of such caliber and not to be treated like guests. The spa is there but not for the guests of the hotel but only for the "guests of the spa". In other words, you have to pay to use the spa. You have to pay for the Wi-fi. You have to pay for the bottles of water. Wherever you look in the room, you find items for sale. One feels s/he in a gift store. Although we did not take a standard room there is no bath tub or any of the extras granted in other similar hotels like cotton buds, Q tips, sewing kit. The place is trying to be hip and chic but it is actually silly and mediocre. The alternative decor does not make-up for the flaws. It's not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, with great security”
Reviews.Author: donckd
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location. Great, center of the city. close to everything. the room was nice with lots of extra's mini bar water snacks. But not for free Everything cost money

Reviews.Title: “Very nice contemporary hotel”
Reviews.Author: xiaopu
Reviews.Content: Nice location very close to Chinatown and two blocks from Subway station. Room was spacious and had very contemporary/modern amenities. Loved the body butter moisturizer that was included with the toiletries. Only complaint is that the bathroom lacked a fan which was not convenient for hot showers or #2s and free wifi was only available in the hotel lobby. Elevators were quick though!

Reviews.Title: “Another overpriced starwood venture...”
Reviews.Author: Nathan Z
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over our anniversary on a month long trip through NYC, New England, Canada and the east coast. The hotel looks nice enough and has lot's of "wannabes" trying to act cool at the bar and lounge. We were put on the 14th floor in the corner suite that we booked after I refused to stay on the 4th floor where they tried to put us upon check in. Even on the 14th floor, the noise on the street was ridiculously loud being graduation weekend in Boston. The room itself was large, but the "soaking tub" which we booked it for barely held one (petite) person. One whole side of the room was windowed, but the curtains had to manually drawn each night which was a right hassle which involved climbing over the couch to complete the chore properly. The staff were a tad arrogant, and that included the 4 guy's acting as doormen who simply just stood outside the hotel chatting and doing stuff all, and looked like they were in pain when asked to do something. There was no free wifi in the room (the only hotel on a month long trip that didn't offer it for free) at $350 odd a night I thought this was pathetic and super scummy of the W. Each time my wife and I had a drink in the bar, our room was charged $50 on top of the drinks amount as a "deposit", this took a week to be refunded to my credit card which was unacceptable as we had numerous drinks down there prior to going out and the "deposit" totalled $400. All in all there are loads of better hotels to stay at in Boston that will be of a higher standard at a cheaper rate and without the arrogant tosser's that seemed to frequent this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Our new fave in Boston”
Reviews.Author: VCARON
Reviews.Content: We travel to Boston every summer for food and fun. This year, we picked the W because of the location and brand ( We are Starwood Gold Members). This hotel was in the most perfect location for our family of four: situated right at the entrance to China Town, walking distance to Quincy Market, Newbury St and the Commons. The staff was SO helpful and the room was a great size. We walked to Commons in less than 10 minutes and watched the fireworks with the locals. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “100% Cool in Boston”
Reviews.Author: mbmuscle
Reviews.Content: Staff is super & attentive to special requests, there the best in the W Hotel chain and really pay attention to their repeat clients, they even remember special occasions. I have stayed there frequently since their opening. The Spice Market restaurant is fantastic! A taste of New York's finest inBoston. The room I stayed in had touch screen controls and ceiling to floor windows with great views of Boston. The valet staff is a cut above and also remember clients who have visited multiple times. I have stayed there for business and pleasure and the Hotel remains excellent. My wife and I look forward to our W Hotel in Boston visits. This is the coolest place that conservative Boston has to offer. There is always a great vibe in the living room and the property is spotless. Everybody should try the Acura MDX shuttle this is arriving in style to your destination in luxury! The best part is it's free only the W has this feature.

Reviews.Title: “A fine W experience at a well-located property”
Reviews.Author: jdlvalium
Reviews.Content: We did a two-night stay at the W, Sunday-Tuesday, using Starwood points. Upon arrival, the valet was prompt and friendly, but also was quick to note the $44/night cost for parking. While I found it a bit outrageous, my wife noted that she was paying $40/night to park at the Westin Copley at least as far back as in 2005 when she would stay there for business. So I guess it's just the cost of parking at an upper-level Boston hotel. Check-in was smooth, and they offered us 500 extra points if we didn't have our room made up each day. We accepted, but more on this later. Despite being told we had to use our key in the elevator to access our floor, we could go to any floor without using the key. Poor security or do they disable this procedure when the hotel isn't full of weekend bar-scene types who aren't guests? Having just stayed at the W in Austin (the one with the windows that fall out!), we appreciated the lighter and more airy decor. While the Austin W was dark and brooding, this one was the opposite. The room was perfectly sized for the two of us, plenty roomy. It may be small by standard hotel sizes, but it wasn't noticed by us. King (or was it a queen?) bed, bathroom with shower, A/C was blowing cool when we walked in. The light didn't work in the water closet, but it was fixed straightaway while we were out. Biggest complaint that I had was our 8th floor room faced Stuart street (main street, front of hotel) and I could hear the sirens and car alarms at night. They didn't bother my wife, so depending on your tolerance for nighttime noise, you may want to ask for a room away from the main street. We didn't experience bar- or restaurant-related noise on Sun or Mon nights. I was disappointed that the Acura valet service shuts down at 4 pm on weekdays. We wanted to use it to go to Cambridge, but could not. It runs later on weekends, and the friendly concierge said they are trying to get the service to extend weekday hours. Despite the 500 points for not making up our room agreement, our room was made up on Monday. Apparently the check-in staff didn't actually note it in our folio. Odd. We ended up still getting the points, but it's odd that they couldn't make this work properly. We did not eat at the hotel, rather had all meals out. We did have drinks one night at the bar. Mine were fine but my wife had a virgin bloody mary that was mere tomato juice. Upon complaining the bartender sampled it, apologized profusely, and whipped up a fresh (and spicy) one immediately. The Sweat gym is a nice facility that is far better than most hotel gyms. It was bigger than the W Atlanta Midtown, but tiny compared with the W Austin. Given our use of Starwood points to stay here I I can't really comment on $$ value. It was worth the points over staying at the Westin Copley (which we've stayed at before), IMHO. The W's nicer furnishings and amenities, and being a smaller and less crowded hotel stood out for us. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “right in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: ThomasKongsberg
Reviews.Content: The W Boston is a stylish, new and clean hotel located conveniently in the city center. The staff was very helpful and friendly, also towards kids (special thanks to the concierge Jennifer) Our room was large and convenient to stay in. The lobby lounge is cool and great place to have a drink and relax, even with kids, they also make nice non-alcoholic cocktails. All in all a highly recommendable place to stay in downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Cute glassy corner room... dismal, dripping service!”
Reviews.Author: swissmap
Reviews.Content: W Boston was a last minute decision as we were 'biking across the States when the Springfield tornadoes were coming through. We quickly went online on the road and booked into the W. So we when we arrived we were wet, in our leathers, on bikes, and wanting a warm welcome! Didn't get it, didn't get it at all.... in fact it was the opposite! The parking manager didn't want to have anything at all to do with the motorbikes, no one helped us with our luggage, we virtually dripped our way to the front desk! Hotels are supposed or (with out sounding older than my 30 something yrs) used to be places of welcoming, respite and hospitality while you are away from home, better (read more expensive) hotels I feel, should try a little harder as they're receiving more of my hard earned money. At the check in we were waiting in line as only one service person was on and no one else was around. After 4-5minutes the chap who had been sitting chatting with someone on the sofa got up and suddenly started serving!!! Not a hotel I could recommend, at all.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally friendly and attentive staff, very modern and the place to be seen.”
Reviews.Author: KollegeKlubMadison
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a single night in June in the "Wow Suite." The checkin staff, specifically Julie, was exceptionally pleasant and greeted me warmly. She was probably one of the most friendly, attentive hotel front desk staff I have ever encountered. She personalized my first interaction with the property by stepping out from behind her checkin desk, explained the hotel features, local area attractions and features of my room. Out of the hundreds of Marriotts, Starwoods, and Hiltons, this was the best greeting I have yet to experience. Very much different than the semi-robotic checkin seen at many big brand hotels. The check-in seemed to cater and be personalized to my needs. I was very impressed. As to the room, it was a W-size (smaller hotel rooms at all W's), but it was a suite. Two rooms, two bathrooms, excceptionally modern furniture, bar (stocked- both soda and liquor w/mixers), great sound system, double flat screens, and very modern but efficient work desk. The power outlets for my work computer were easy to access, and the desk chair was of reasonable comfort. (I have not been to many big-brand hotels that have comfortable work-desk chairs, so it was "reasonable" as compared to others). Most noticably, the floor-to-ceiling windows surrounds the living room, and the dining table, along with the exceptionally plush living room carpeting were a nice enhancement. The carpeting and unique "flowing" furniture in the living room was very modern, but stilll exceptionally comfortable and inviting. Some of the windows opened to let in fresh air- a welcome touch for a heavy business traveler. The hotel exercise room was standard W, not perfect, somewhat smaller than it should be, but efficient. Food, both room service and bar service were excellent. Prices of rooms at this property are higher than most competitors, but you are paying for the "W" experience. At night, the downstairs bar transformed into a hip, welcoming crowd. Very social and the music wasn't too loud. It was a good mix of many age groups, business and some of the local colleges. As to bed quality, it was standard heavenly bed (from Westin) adapted to W standards. It was very comfortable and supportive. The bathroom was very large, and the towels were fluffy, soft and not-worn. Between the bed and towel quality, I was quite happy. Overall, this was an excellent W experience. I would stay here again. I do recommend this property highly. It is worth the extra money on the nightly room costs. And if you can, splurge for the Wow or other suites. They are an experience. Thanks Julie!

Reviews.Title: “Very Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: LKH95
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early for our reservation and our room wasn't ready. They were very accomodating and offered us a room to use to freshen up for the function we had to attend and could move to our room later, when it was ready. We were very appreciative for the consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but frustrating.”
Reviews.Author: mattgswimguy
Reviews.Content: Okay, so of course, it's a W Hotel. It was very nice. The staff however, not so much. We went early to check in, and of course, they don't let you, but they did allow us to request a room. So we requested a room next to our friends on a high floor. They gladly agreed saying they had them available they just had to clean them, and that they would bring our luggage up. So we left to do the Freedom Trail, and came back around 4. When we asked, they said that they had to get our luggage, and find rooms for us. Even though they already told us they had rooms, they didn't. I would rather them be honest and say "We will see if anything comes available." instead of "Oh right here! We have them!" So we waited 15 minutes for them to get 9our luggage, then went upstairs. The hallways were.... weird. There was a mural of a man with his head in bush, and it was like that like 10 times down the hallway- CREEPY. The rooms were very nice, and we were satisfied. After dinner however, that's when it went wrong. First of all, the lights in the room are connected to the same circuiting as the bathroom. When I went to go to the bathroom during the night, the lights didn't work, and I didn't know why so I just used my phone as a light. Next, my mom went to use the bathroom, and had the same problem. She discovered that the bathroom lights would only turn on if EVERY LIGHT INT HE ROOM was on. How is this a good idea? Everybody goes to the bathroom at night! It was miserable! Then, the air conditioning was poor too. It would turn on and become extremely cold. Then, it would turn off in 5 minutes, and become extremely hot. It did this all night. Awful. Overall, I didn't like the hotel. I got 2 hours of sleep and was miserable the next day. Go stay at a Marriott instead.

Reviews.Title: “Typical W, good and bad”
Reviews.Author: jack783
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what I've come to expect of all W Hotels: what I would call business-traveler trendy. That is, just enough trendiness to be hip but with enough amenities to appeal to older business traveler. As with the other Ws I've stayed at, it's not about the nightly room charge, which is reasonable, it's about the extras. Want to park? $44/night. Want internet? $14.95. Want eggs benedict for breakfast? $21. Want that bottle of Fuji water next to your bed? $7. And so on. It's been a long time since I stayed in a room with no coffee maker, and I've stayed in hotels at all price points. There is free coffee in the lobby in the morning but more likely they want you to order it with your room service breakfast for $10. Everything else is fine, the room is a decent size, the bed is comfortable. I had no issues with the service. Just be ready to pay for extras.

Reviews.Title: “Modern chic hotel poor service”
Reviews.Author: Funguy88
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the chic W hotel Boston. Disappointed by the service at the welcome desk. Check in took 30min because not enough people working at the desk for both check in and check out customers. They really need to hire more people. The location is good and the room is modern and new. The bliss spa was wonderful and definitely worth trying out. Will not return because of the poor service. There are many hotels in Boston and you should try other ones and skip this one. I always try to stay at the W when I can but this one is definitely not worth staying at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun & Well Positioned”
Reviews.Author: Adsandkev
Reviews.Content: Booked in for 4 nights before flying to washington, they arranged for me to be collected from the airport and greeted me by name on arrival at the hotel, what a great start. The room was large with a lovely bed, in the usual W style which i must say i enjoy, although its not for everyone. Excellent bathroom with lovely double shower and bliss products, the shower could do with more pressure would be my main comment with the room. The lounge/bar is certainly the place to meet people, lots of locals use it and the drinks are great and so are the bar staff. Breakfast was well served and again the staff were friendly and helpful. All in all a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice room, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Mervmeister
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in a standard king bed room. The rate was reasonable for a good Boston Hotel, but you are hit with a $44 dollar nigh parking fee if you drive and a $15 fee for room internet access.. From the doormen to the reception staff, everyone was friendly and helpful. The room was clean with a big screen tv, cordless phones, and a nice glass-enclosed shower. There's no real lobby, since the bar are takes up most of the ground floor space. There's a decent restaurant for breakfast in the lobby also. The location, right in the heart of the theater district, near the Boston Commons, is ideal. Someone told me the hotel is being sold to another chain soon. I don't know if that is true, but right now I can definitely recommend it for people looking for a nice place to stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Tried most of Boston's top hotels, and nothing beats the W.”
Reviews.Author: PCD624
Reviews.Content: I visit Boston every month for business. To put it simply, you won't find a better hotel than the W Boston. What makes this hotel number 1? The staff. While of course you can expect a great bar, top-notch nightlife (one of the best bars in town), and highly-rated restaurant, what you won't find anywhere else is a staff that will go above and beyond to cater to your every need. Special shout out to Liqun & Paul, for making every stay a truly perfect one. This hotel knows hospitality better than anyone. When it comes time to book your next trip to Boston, the W is the obvious choice.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you expect from a W hotel”
Reviews.Author: erikbox
Reviews.Content: This place is all about the trendy and chic. Gotta love it. It attracts some good looking people too. You feel hot when you are in this place. I like that the W hotels feel like clubs and not the standard hotel. It is something different than the typical floral coverlet and bagels for breakfast. The hotel is pricey, but no more than you would expect for the quality. I always stay at Starwood hotels when the company pays! lol

Reviews.Title: “Decent, though Ã¼ber trendy”
Reviews.Author: erikpvd
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked online for a decent rate. It was somewhat of a last-minute change as my original plans were changed by my brother's recent move and a subsequently dirty house. Given this is a new hotel to Boston, I was keen to see how it was. First impressions: Staff are very friendly and personable. While checking us in, the agent was chatty, inquiring about where we were coming from and the reason for our trip and offered up any help that was needed. The lobby is not terribly spacious, yet makes nice use of stone to provide a cool yet classic look. In addition, the bar is located next to the check-in area and it doubles a happening nightspot at night, so there is plenty of comfortable seating. Room: If you like the most recent trends (that are somewhat yuppie), then the W is for you. The entry (foyer?) is dimly lit for mood. A dark carpet and muted walls don't do much to brighten this area up much either. Those with difficulty in dark spaces or deficient vision should take note. There is some cool art on the walls that leads you into the rest of the room. The washroom is absolutely huge, however I feel they could have provided a bit more space for the toilet. The door passes by literally less than 1 cm from the toilet, forcing you to stand rather awkwardly beside the toilet in order to close the door. Again, the lighting in the washroom could be improved slightly. Not that it's terrible, but if you're someone who appreciates light when getting yourself ready for a night on the town, maybe bring some kind of lantern. The last negative to the room is the amount of dead space. With a huge foyer and washroom, it felt like the area around the bed was tighter than it needed to be. This, however, could be because we were near the elevators, so not every room may necessarily be shaped like this (Note: If you do find yourself next to the elevators, see if you can be moved. While it wasn't terrible, there was a noticeable noise whenever the elevators were in motion). I will say, the bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in at a hotel. Furthermore, if possible, get a room facing the south. Not only do you get sun most of the day (to help combat the darkness), you also get a lovely view toward some of the more charming areas of the city. Given that the top half of the building is condos, those with a northerly exposure will, for the most part, just look across to the office building on the other side of Stuart St. Another advantage to the southerly exposure is that there are a lot of nightclubs in the vicinity. Stuart St. is arguably more traffic jammed at 2am on a Friday and Saturday night than at 5pm on a Wednesday, with a lot of people and cars. While the windows are remarkably well insulated, if you want to sleep with an open window, it could be a bit noisy. Amenities: Didn't use much of them. There is a full-service spa attached to the hotel. There is also a small fitness centre that has decent equipment. The 'business centre' is really just two iMacs (that run on Windows) at the end of the corridor on the ballroom level. Free internet is provided though there is a charge for printing. As mentioned, there is a bar on the ground level in the lobby that becomes quite happening at night. If you are a younger visitor, make sure you have a room key if coming back to the room at night. They appear to do ID checks at the door for people heading to the bar. A flash of the room key will ensure trouble-free access. There is also a restaurant with a menu created by Jean-Georges. I don't know who he is but he's done other restaurants for the W hotels. It appears to be good, though a bit pricey. Location: You can't beat the W's location. Located at Tremont and Stuart Sts., the W sits above the Theatre District. Perennial favourites like The Blue Man Group are just around the corner, as are the Wang and Shubert Theatres. The Opera House (home of The Nutcracker), Paramount and Modern Theatres (and their affiliated universities) are just a couple of blocks away near Downtown Crossing. The Boston Common and Public Gardens, as well as the shopping and dining strips of Boylston and Newbury Streets, and the charms of the Back Bay and South End are just a short walk away. Overall, a like a ultra-modern dÃ©cor is necessary, otherwise it can be a bit obnoxious. Furthermore, the brand the W creates for itself is a bit self-indulgent. But, if you don't mind that, or you have stayed at other Ws and you like the brand, then I suspect you'll be very happy with the W Boston. Given the W often tries to find unique properties (like their Union Square property in New York), the exterior of this building is a bit bland, but they've added nice touches to give it a different vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and classy. But very awkward room if you need privacy.”
Reviews.Author: markandjill7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Boston Marathon. The hotel was only one block from the subway and Boston Commons. The rooms were very clean, and the decor nice but was very contemporary. Perhaps too contemporary. There was absolutely no privacy for the bathroom. A glass door from the hallway, and NO WALL at all between the bathroom and the bedroom. There was a kind of meshy screen that separated the bathroom from the beds, but it was transparent. Fine and all if you are travelling with someone you don't mind seeing you naked, but for 2 teenage boys, it was very uncomfortable. Great location, great service. The beds were very comfortable as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. Even with kids.”
Reviews.Author: tradergirl93
Reviews.Content: I know the W isn't really a family destination. But we got a good rate via Starwood email. I expected--and received--a low-ish floor room near the elevators because of my super cheapo rate. (That always happens) But it was fine. Not too loud in spite of location. Now, I don't love the location of this hotel. It's fine, but not quite as central as some others. Chinatown is handy, but other restaurants not so much. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean, and in very new condition. The bathroom privacy thing is a little weird-- a scrim hides the sink & tub area from the main part of the room. The loss of toweling off privacy didn't bother me so much, but there's no way at all to leave a bathroom light on during the night without blinding yourself. There was no separate light switch for the little toilet room either. Foiled again. Thank you for the blackberry/iphone charging station! And for the built-in tiny book lights. Very classy. But $15 for wireless internet??? That seems outrageous in this day and age. We went to the "Market" restaurant for breakfast. The menu is really quite limited, but the execution was great. But pricey. Tip: the room service menu has children's selections, the restaurant does not. (But I wouldn't expect it to.) I wish I'd had time to visit the Bliss spa on the premises.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more for a W stay...nice but overprized”
Reviews.Author: sunnyfer
Reviews.Content: mmm I've been on the New York W before, so I definetly wanted to go at the one in Boston, 'cause my stay was soo amazing at the 1st one.... I can tell, location wasn't the best, it was little far away from the usual places u visit in Boston. The bar was right there at the lobby, and it was nice, just not W nice...food was excellent, but way too expensive. But the room and bathroom..wooow woonderful! gorgeous design, soft sheets, and lots of pillows! love my room! The service was ok, but they have this unique program called "warever wenever" that u can ask for anything u want and they will do anything to make it happen, well everything I ask for, they don't have, and they don't even try to make any effort for u...I was a little dissapointed 'cause the one on NY was unbelievable in its service too. So rooms, designs and decoration, peerfect...service and location, not that much, specially for how much u paid! $$$$! Of course I was on my honeymoon, so they deliver a nice detail to our room, strawberries and wine! That was cool. :)

Reviews.Title: “avoid street facing rooms, else hear the club noise until 3am”
Reviews.Author: skim500
Reviews.Content: Love the hotel location - theater district close to china town. Easy access to I-93, I-90, logan airport, walking distance to the T, walk to grocery store & restaurants, etc. Of course the bar has interesting people watching. I saw an older business man wearing a sports coat, pick up a younger woman by mimicking her yoga poses at the bar. Quiet entertaining. Bad news, when I checked in, the first room they gave me was dirty and occupied. The 2nd room was facing the street. The comforter had some sort of blood? stains on it which I could ignore. Unfortunately the bars let out at 2am and the drunk crowds descend upon the street, blocking the taxis, causing the horns a honking, which I couldn't ignore. Unless you want to feel like you're leaving a rave until 3am, don't get a room facing the street. I called the front office who connected me to the manager and I requested a different room. Unfortunately they were sold out. Good news is they refunded my stay for the night and moved me the next day to a nice room on the highest floor away from the street and I slept just fine the rest of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for the level of service you get”
Reviews.Author: Patrick_Bateman
Reviews.Content: (School notes from A-F) Check-In: "E" While we were greated and taken care when arriving with our cab, it got very awful at check-in. The receptionist did not recognize and greet me as a Platinum Member. So I asked her if I was upgraded according to the SPG policies. She replied, yes I just see you were given a nice spetacular room. I laughed and told her, this was the category I had originally booked. She said, ok, and disappeared for like 5 minutes. After she returned she gave me a corner room at a low floor... so I had a corner view to some walls ... nice... . As I get free Breakfast in most Starwood Hotels with a dedicatd lounge, the receptionist denied my request. Room: "B-" The room was very modern and nicely decorated. The bed was fantastic. However some items were "overdesigned". The TV is so low, that, if you are in bed and wanna watch TV, you see only your feet and not the TV. In all other Starwood-Hotels I stayed before you had at least two bottles of free water. Check-Out: "B" Good standard - nothing to note. If this was a mediocre priced hotel around 150 USD it would be rated medium, but they want USD 300+, but dont deliver...

Reviews.Title: “Good intentions and fun touches but I expected better.”
Reviews.Author: JTworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Willing concierge and door staff. Total front desk confusion -- billing will take my accounting dept hours to straighten out. Courtesy car only runs 8 am to 4 pm - not useful. Rooms have some fun design touches but no lighting in WC room. Is that supposed to be trendy? There is no way to turn off electric "daylight" panel in the room without turning out the master switch for all lights in the room -- which means you can't leave only the bathroom light on at night. My room was next to heath club. At 5 am it starts to get busy and if anyone uses the equipment on the adjoining wall and bumps the weights against their stops, it sounds like pile drivers. There are better hotels for the price (Langham, and Four Seasons, for example) -- although perhaps not as hip.

Reviews.Title: “What A Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dobrien-1
Reviews.Content: We drove in to Boston easily to Stuart Street. You hear of how bad Boston driving is...and it is, but The W is right off the highway and very easy. We used the valet and garage for the tune of 44 a day but so what! I was immediately impressed when they opened the door to the lobby. Modern, clean, smiles everywhere. Quick easy check in...we were also an hour or so early and that was no issue. It took me a little bit to figure the room card in the elevator trick but I got through it! The room was super clean spacious and nice. Comfortable bed...pillows are a bit squashy. Nice tv. Bathroom needs attention. Lighting was ok but could be better. The toilet was in a separate closet type room in the bath, no vent. Needs a vent. Vent is in the shower stall itself. Not in the toilet closet....needs a vent....badly. The bathroom is also kind of open to the room. It has a large opening that is covered by a tapestry of sorts. Not at all soundproof to the rest of the room. I'm not sure how I feel about that. It was not an issue for us but may be to others. Awesome location. Close to everything you need except a liquor store. The one thing that kind of bothered me was the snacks and little refrigerator full of very expensive cheap things. Peanuts, Oreo s , Chips ect...7 to 10 dollars and up! "really ?" 8 dollars for a beer out of the fridge...needless to say I had none of this stuff. My suggestion...sell those beers for a normal price and maybe you will sell more! I got a fridge delivered up to the room at no charge and stocked my own bar. Just remember to BYOB if you like to have a couple in the room...too much of a hassle to get it once your there and too much $$$$$$$$$. I'm not cheap but I do have standards. Restaurants all around. Theaters all that and more. I say go to the W and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service ...”
Reviews.Author: resixx
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the W hotel started nicely. The rooms are modern and nice. The service however was terrible throughout our entire stay. It seems that job criteria for the staff are rather based on how people look than on their intelligence. I will only mention a few things: - I ordered two packages to the hotel. The first one was delivered to my room, but nobody knew where the second one was. It took several calls to the concierge until the package was finally found. - My mom left her pants in the room which we discovered when we had already returned to Europe. The first person said that they had not been found. A couple of e-mails later they had suddenly appeared. And were shipped to Germany. I told the hotel that they should ship them via regular postal mail as there was no hurry. However, the only shipping service they were using was Fedex, so it cost me approx. 90 USD to have the pants delivered to Switzerland. Probably it would have been to much of an effort to go to the USPS station instead of having the Fedex guy come right to the hotel. - Unfortunately, a colleague of ours who left earlier than we did also left a jacket in his room. As we were still at the hotel, we asked at the reception for it. This one wasn't found. We were "offered" the jacket of another guest instead, who apparently had left his jacket in the same room before our stay. - On our invoice there appeared a position of an additional approx. USD 1'500 - nobody could tell us what the charge was for. It wasn't until days after our stay and many e-mails back and forth that W transferred the money back to our accounts. We never learned what the charge was about. - The electronic keys did not work many times so we had to go down to the reception to have new ones issued. One time when we discovered that our key was not working, a friendly W staff member came up to us and told us that he'd run down for us to get us a new key while we could wait in front of our room. The person never returned. All in all, people did not seem to have any problem solving ability. I have a feeling, W Boston staff members are "trained" for certain processes - and as soon as something goes wrong don't know what to do. Problems are transferred to other staff members instead of looking for a solution themselves. I have no idea what W means claiming "whenever wherever service" in its advertising. So this was definitely my last stay at the W Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need and a fine example of customer service”
Reviews.Author: elainie2c
Reviews.Content: My first time ever at the W chain of hotels, we spent one night in the city. From start to finish, customer service was top notch, they even gave everyone staying that weekend a a choice of reward for elevator maitenance that weekend which we didnt even feel the effect of. Our room was wrapped around by windows overlooking the city, very comfy bed, everything was fresh. Loved the shower. We started the evening in their cozy lobby bar/lounge...warning, after 6pm the lounge gets crowded, and by 10pm there are hoards of people outside waiting to get in, its a very popular gathering place. We ate the edamame appetizer in chili oil, it was delicious and light. We went elsewhere for dinner but came back for coffee and dessert at Market, it was fantastic. The cheesecake was superb. We felt like we had a full weekend away and it was just one night, we felt very comfortable and enjoyed the hotel, we will definitely come back and take advantage of more of their facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel experience. Above and beyond the call!”
Reviews.Author: paperorganix
Reviews.Content: I booked this weekend trip as a surprise for my boyfriend's birthday. Usually I don't take the time to write reviews but after even he admitted this was the best hotel experience he ever had (and he's very verrrry picky) I decided to jump on trip advisor. I had emailed the staff regarding our trip to both check in early at noon, and ask them if they could put a balloon or something small in the room to indicate a birthday celebration. We arrived even earlier than I had thought- but the room was still ready, with a cupcake, balloon + card. perfectly classy!! Besides that, they helped us get a table at a fully booked *more happening* restaurant and then cancelled our old reservation I had made. We had a drink at their interior bar and it was very fun- good young crowd with plenty of bustle to take in. Lastly, when we got home that night after quite a few cocktails, there were two bottles of water and two packets of the hotel's emergen-c type meds with a card that read "heard you're going big tonight, thought these would help in the morning' or something like that. Unreal. perfect perfect perfect. Oh- and the "spectacular" room was superb-roomy, immaculate and great Bliss products in the bathroom. Kudos to the W Hotel Boston for going above the call of duty... Customer service with personality is still alive.

Reviews.Title: “W wins again...”
Reviews.Author: showbizandi
Reviews.Content: I've only ever written one other review for this site and it was for a W hotel. Well, here I am again...this time it's the Boston property. From arrival to departure this hotel never failed to impress. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable (look out for Noah on Reception) and the rooms are picture perfect. I was lucky enough to meet the W Insider (I thought they were a work of fiction) for whom no task was too much. If you're looking for somewhere to stay in Boston, it's worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the W in Boston,MA”
Reviews.Author: Judelevi
Reviews.Content: It was our first time but will not be our last!!! Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and could not do enough to make sure we had a good time. We had a hard time with working the lights in the room but that was taken care of once we listened to the phone message. The rooms were good size and the beds were very comfy. I love the extra wording around the hotel and in the rooms, I will let you find them yourself. The location was good and there were always taxi's right outside. We used valet and they were quick considering the location on the street. We are going back to try out the spa....it look great!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - trendy, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Volsk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of nights on a business trip and had a great stay. The staff were very friendly, my room was enormous, clean, comfortable and the extras were great (good quality bathroom products, phone charger etc.) The food in the restaurant was exceptional, with very knowledgable wait staff and the bar downstairs was fun but not pretentious. The only thing I could criticise is that there should be more people at the check in desk - every time I came downstairs there was a queue - there seemed to always be one person there despite spare desks and computers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - fine addition to the W Chain”
Reviews.Author: SuitNflipflops
Reviews.Content: This very new (opened Fall 2009) hotel and addition to the W chain has a great downtown location. Rooms are spacious for a W, with the amenities typical for Ws, and walk in showers that one can see into from the room through a painted screen (the coolness factor). Had dinner at the restaurant with a friend. Service was excellent as was the food. Hotel was completely empty which considering how normally packed W lobbies are, made this seem even more deserted. Guess I shouldn't complain since I got a great rate as a result.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: lkuhn
Reviews.Content: Hip place with extremely convenient location, close to everything. kids loved the fact it was so close to new berry st

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but expected more”
Reviews.Author: TravellerJ0e
Reviews.Content: I was told about about this place by couple of my colleagues , and this stay was pleasant. The service was OK, as not many staff were not able to pinpoint area locales. The rooms were decent sized and overall location was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Some nice things, but...”
Reviews.Author: anne111310
Reviews.Content: Pros: Best location for theaters, service from staff exceptional, rooms very modern, comfy beds and very clean. Cons: Very poor lighting in bathroom; very difficult to apply makeup. My biggest complaint: I ordered a Grey Goose martini in the bar; it was VERY watery. Thinking it had sat in the shaker a bit, I asked for another...same thing. My husband ordered a Ketel One martini; same thing. A bar at this level and price ($16) should not water down the liquor.

Reviews.Title: “The WOW Suite was just that: "Wow"!”
Reviews.Author: BirdieKate
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a wonderful winter's night in a 12th floor "Wow Suite" recently at this hotel and can't wait to go back. The Wow Suites are in corner rooms, so there are windows to the city on two complete sides, but with room-darkening curtains that do a great job of giving privacy when needed. Other than that, open them up and enjoy the view of the city at night. The decor is modern, trendy and comfortable. On the living room side, there is seating for 6-7 people, a beautiful wet bar, a large flat-screen TV and a smashing Bang & Olufsen stereo system -- bring your CDs and invite a few friends up! There's a small dining table graced with orchids, and a plush, soft shag-style rug underfoot. Super comfy, fun, and showy. On the bedroom side, there's a lovely king bed with deluxe bedding, a well-appointed desk with internet access and anything you need to get some work done. A curved couch with soft pillows sits in front of the windows. There's a second large flat-screen TV in there. Bed was super comfortable and the room was very quiet - had a great night's sleep. Great task lighting on the bed (reading lamps attached to the headboard on either side) was a big plus. The bathroom is very big, great jacuzzi tub, and a marble stall shower. I really appreciated the lighted magnifying makeup mirror. There's a second bathroom over on the living room side -- this, plus the ability to completely close off the bedroom from the living room really make this space suitable for entertaining - especially if there are two of you, and one has company while the other wants to get some rest. This is a very "hip" hotel and while the staff is younger, they still give great, attentive service. Complimentary coffee is offered in the lobby in the morning but I'm a tea drinker so they fixed me tea upon request. Concierge Jennifer was delightful and very helpful. This hotel is smack dab in the middle of the theater district. We had theater tickets and it was a very quick walk to the theater from the hotel. The Wang and the Shubert were within sight of the room - this is a great place to stay when you're seeing a show. Breakfast the next day was hearty and delicious. We can't wait to go back for another night on the town.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is more than just words - it is their creed!”
Reviews.Author: bjaune
Reviews.Content: W Boston claims that the "W" means WOW and that their goal is to "wow" you. True to form they did wow us! Because we were celebrating our anniversary, I contacted the hotel directly prior to arrival to make a room request and advise them of the special occasion. Upon arrival in our room we were greeted with champagne and chocolate-dipped strawberries (at no charge). While the room requested and promised was not available the first night they upgraded us to a beautiful, corner suite for the rest of our stay. Additionally, they "comped" us a free breakfast and some drinks at the bar as a gesture for the initial let-down. The rooms are nicely appointed in a modernistic style. The front desk staff is very friendly and takes a genuine interest in answering your questions and providing directions to various sites. The hotel is centrally located in the Tremont section near several theaters and within walking distance of Chinatown, Boston Commons (park), Cheers Bar (from TV series) and Newbury Street (upscale shopping district). Moreover, it is within easy walking distance (7 mins.) of the Subway system (Bolyston Station) which proffers economical access to the entire transportation network of Boston. Getting to/from the airport by subway/train is easy involving one change (at Gov't Center) and takes about 30 mins. if no delay. We highly recommend this hotel because of its commitment to customer service, great rooms and central location. Small issues for some may be that the outside street noise can be heard within some rooms - particularly if there is a lot of traffic or noisy crowds outside (which may occur on Friday and Saturday nights). Also, light sleepers may be bothered by the low-level, ambient hum from the HVAC vent/ductwork that may exist in select rooms. Finally, be forewarned that using the mini-bar will add up as prices are not cheap! As STARWOOD properties go - this is a very good one!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great addition to the Boston hotel scene - 2 fantastic stays!”
Reviews.Author: pepebrie
Reviews.Content: In the past month I have visited the W Boston twice for leisure. In November my husband and I stayed for a weekend after Thanksgiving visits with family and we returned December 17th with a friend visiting from Colordao. I grew up in the Boston area and when I return from NYC for visits I often take the least expensive hotel I can find. Having not lived there for 5+ years I was surprised to see that the W was built near the theatre district. This was not the best area growing up but has really made huge changes. The check in was thorough and quick both times and the staff super-friendly. The W is known to be a bit of a scene so check-in happens amidst the hotel lobby bar which is always packed. The rooms are really nice. We stayed in a King and a 2DBL. The showers are not behind a closed door so be aware if you are traveling with friends and want privacy. The usual W products from bliss are always a treat. The linens were lovely. Our room had a huge window but tons of drapes if you wanted it more dark. Room service is oferred until very late at night. The W has an Acura car svc that has somewhat random hours but they will take you within 3 miles for free. Otherwise cabs are easy to come by. This is a great location to get to the South End, Back Bay or downtown. TIP: If you are bringing a car avoid the W valet ($40/day) and park across the street in the Transportation Building garage for half the price. We felt very safe here. The staff was super-attentive. We didn't have to switch rooms when we added a night on both occasions. I would absolutely recommend this hotel for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful W Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alohaboys4
Reviews.Content: Great trendy hotel in a pretty good location to see most of Boston. I had a wonderful experience and was upgraded to a Wow Corner Suite due to SPG Platinum Status? I wasn't expecting much of an upgrade since I was staying on SPG Points for 2 nights but the suite was a very nice surprise :-) The King Bed was really enjoyable. The Housekeeping/Style Department did a good job of keeping everything tidy and clean. Only slight problem was maid removed small box of leftover pizza from Figs Resturant :-( Bathroom had a giant Shower and seperate bathtub, towels were nice and soft. Both Jennifer and Ken at the Concierge Desk were very helpful with my questions, directions and restaurant reservations. Super helpful people. I enjoyed the free ride in an Acura SUV to a South End local diner Mike's. Location of hotel is pretty good, 4 minute walk to Boston Common, Chinatown and The T line Subway. I didn't have any problems with the in room wireless Iinternet connections worked fine for me. I enjoyed the free Hot Apple Cider each night coming in from the Cold Boston Evening Weather which was located at the welcome desk area. They had coffee set up in the morning too. Nice touch. I've been to other W Hotels and this one is one the better ones.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Great Area”
Reviews.Author: kellycm2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Boston in October. We stayed on a special corporate rate, otherwise it was overpriced. It is a very nice hotel, but the standard rooms are small. The showers are very nice though. You can walk many places from the hotel. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Blissh - Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: mdditt2000
Reviews.Content: I am surprised to see that the W Boston has mediocre reviews. This is my fourth W hotel that I have stayed at. The W hotel is definitely way above the rest. I stayed at the W Boston for two nights after a few days in New York. Personally I am discouraged by the hotel price per night. The W New Work Times Square was $500 per night while the W Boston was $300. However while on business the W chain is the place to stay if you can expense it. The rooms are modern and clean. They all have a fresh smell. Love the apples when checking in. It beats getting a cookie. The girl at the front desk was new when I checked in. She struggled with my colleagueâ€™s reservation. But she was cute!! In fact they got his rate wrong. He had to have them change the rate when checking out. I am huge fan of the Bliss product. I purchased some Bliss products from the store in the hotel lobby. Make sure you check your luggage when flying home. You would not want to give it to TSA. When using the sweat gym take the Bliss tidy towel. These are great for the flight home. I wish they sold those towels or provided them in the rooms. I ate at the restaurant in the bar and the food was very good. Service was slow at first but improved during the evening. The burger was perfect. The W hotel has a trendy bar scene. Itâ€™s the perfect place for people watching after a long day in the office. They have a great list of bears on the menu. Try avoiding using the mini bar. They will charge you $4.50 for a Pepsi. Omg you can 12 for that price. That should be illegal. The W staff is excellent. The service is superior to other hotel which I have stayed at. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great W Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sginmd
Reviews.Content: The W Boston is very cool and in a great location. We could walk to Boston Common and Copley Place. Quincy Market was a bit far but was okay for us to walk. The staff was very nice and accomodating. Room was always clean. Got late checkout as an SPG member which was great. Will return next time we are in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: stranz86
Reviews.Content: I stayed over at W Boston for a group business meeting and I have to say despite the freezing cold, W Boston was a great place to warm up! We had cocktails in the lounge, the room was super cool with the munchie box and the blue and green motifs. The welcome desk was amazingly accommodating whenever I had questions or I asked for recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Party0f2
Reviews.Content: Wow! I recently stayed at the W Hotel for a business trip to Boston and was totally impressed by the quality of the service and the comfort of the rooms. Not only did I enjoy a luxurious stay in my favorite city, but they really lived up to their motto "Whatever, Whenever". The great service began at the welcome desk, where I was greeted and checked in by a friendly staff member and escorted to my gorgeous room. What a relief after a long cross-country flight! It was quiet, but still fun and hip. Perfect for a business trip. I ordered dinner in my room that evening and was pleased by the quick service and a fantastic meal. The hotel restaurant also has great food and I hosted a client for dinner and a well-chosen bottle of wine on my second night. My stay at the W Boston was a positive experience and I would certainly recommend to anyone who expects phenomenal service.

Reviews.Title: “Average, not amazing”
Reviews.Author: goldfishgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W during a weekend trip to Boston. The Hotel: The W is definitely trendy, so if you're into dleek lines and ultra modern look you'll probably really love the hotel. In the evenings the bar was super trendy, cocktails were expensive but delicious. The evening we arrived their was an opening night party for a movie. This is the perfect hotel if you're a late night partier/club goer. The Staff: Staff were very attentive and friendly. Their whatever, whenever service is taken very seriously. The Room: We were definitely less than impressed with the room. We were using a 50% off rate coupon from our Starwood Hotel American Express card so maybe that's why we were given such a tiny room. Still, for nearly $300/night I would expect much better. The room was VERY tiny with a view overlooking a parking garage and another hotel. I live in new york city so I'm used to tiny real estate spaces but this was pretty cramped. I'm not sure how well the rooms were cleaned, our toilet area had a smell of vomit the first night we arrived. We were too tired from the workday/travel on Friday night to complain. The Location: Really good location, right in the theater district, short 5 minute walk to the Boston Common, 5 minute walk to the T station. Close to Chinatown. There aren't tons of places to eat right nearby, we ended eating more in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “FUN!”
Reviews.Author: loveswildlife
Reviews.Content: Loved the W Boston. Sparkling clean. Young, fresh vibe. GREAT party scene. Very modern touches - bathrooms are huge and are comparable to ones in Vegas. DEFINITELY stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: traveler3032
Reviews.Content: Love the W vibe, excellent staff (incredibly friendly and warm), anything requested is done immediately and without question. Having the Bliss spa right next door a bonus. Quiet, large room with all of the things one needs (felt like a studio apt!). Absolutely fantastic experience!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, young and hip hotel that's kind of lost”
Reviews.Author: ykang
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly and rooms are modern and trendy. However, service is not what's expected of other starwood hotels - more of reactive service than proactive when things go wrong. Also, there is no big difference between a regular room and what seems to be a mini suite - just bigger and more furniture. No extra perks (such as more choice of snacks, slippers, etc.) that make the room stand out.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Bathroom Lighting a Visit Killer”
Reviews.Author: SlickToronto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from two nights at the W in Boston. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are spacious and very nice, the beds are amazingly comfortable and the straff couldn't be more helpful. Unfortunately, there is a major design flaw that means we will not return to the hotel unless it is addressed. The lighting in the bathroom and shower area is atrocious! We don't know how the hotel could have been built with such poor lighting but you cannot see properly to shave or put on makeup and there is no light in the shower area. In addition, it should be noted that the towels are very rough, as is the toilet paper. I do not believe this hotel is up to W standards.

Reviews.Title: “great first impression of W”
Reviews.Author: bcjordan
Reviews.Content: This was the first time that I actually stayed at a W and it was great! I thought that the rooms were very large and I loved all the cute little saying around the room. The shower and amenities were great. I had a meeting in the hotel and they did a very nice job and I thought that the break treats were "out of the box". I came back to my room and had a little amenity with 3 dessert pumpkins...really cute. I ordered room service dinner and it was quick and tasty...a little on the pricey side though. The bell staff was lacking in service and greeting, however I thought that the housekeeper on my floor (6th floor, stayed on 11/18) was awesome. She greeted me everytime I walked past her and was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: mariaw888
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Boston to see a show and stayed one night at the W on Stuart St. It was a perfect location for us. Many restaurants within walking distance and the theaters are literally right at the front door. We had read about the barely there bathroom wall and really it is no big deal. The toliet is in it's own separate room with a door so that isn't an issue. The lighting is strange enough that they leave a message on the telephone voicemail explaining to leave the master light switch on, which of course I forgot about and had to stumble over to it in the dark to put the bathroom light on. But, the room is very nice and clean, the bed is the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on and the staff is really super nice. We had no issues at all with noise. We are looking foward to our next visit soon.

Reviews.Title: “All Gloss, weak substance.”
Reviews.Author: ryan123Dc
Reviews.Content: Horrible internet. So sloooooow. Counld't get work down. Staff are very nice but only 1 inch thick. My bill need re-adjusting and they have no idea what is going on and jerking me around. This hotel is all gloss no substance. W sucks. The room feels like a CVS - they are selling too much stuff..... so tasteless and tacky.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Marc25
Reviews.Content: We were a group of four guys visiting the city of Boston. The W is just what we looked for, a chic, trendy and well located hotel. The service from all the staff is so amazing I felt like a superstar at every moment at this hotel. Lenny, Noah, Ken and the incredible Melvin will take care of everything you need, Whatever, whenever... Also, after I stayed at the W Montreal, and New york ( Times square ), I can say the one in Boston is the one I had the best service, period. The thing I liked about the W's are their trendy lounge bars. Forget about going out in clubs, you will find everything you need at those spacious and comfortable seat. Did I mentionned the excellent service of the barmaids and waitress ?! Wow. If you are a group of friends, bachelors or bachelorette young couple, looking for meeting great people who wants to have fun, you are at the good place, the best place. Rooms are pretty small but that is the W , you don't go there for the room anyway...

Reviews.Title: “Very typical of W hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: I agree with the pros and cons written by previous reviewers. This is a very nice hotel that is in an ideal location, close to all parts of Boston, public transport, nightlife, and restaurants. The bar scene is pretty fun, but the prices are typical of W hotels. The service at check in was smooth and easy, as was check out. My room was on the 14th floor and faced the transportation building. Noise was only a problem in the morning with honking cars and few ambulances (thanks to the Tufts Medical Center ER being a few blocks away). The windows could be tighter, but it wasn't a serious issue. The layout of the room was very nice with moderately comfortable lounge chairs, great sweetsleeper bed, and great bathroom. The issues about the toilet not having windows or exhaust are real and should be addressed. I was alone so the screen between the sink and the bedroom wasn't an issue, but it wasn't 100% transparent, so unless you are staring at the screen you wouldn't have too much to write home about. The one thing that bugged me about the bathroom was the lighting and mirror. I have bad vision and don't shave with my glasses on, so not having a bright light and a mirror about two feet away made shaving a bit challenging. They do have a small mirror with a light, but it's on the counter, forcing me to bed over and down to look into, a bit awkward. Also, it would be great if they would at least have a water boiler for even instant coffee, but nothing is available. Room service coffee is $13 and if you don't mind throwing on some clothes, Starbucks is across the street for $2 coffee. Overall, I loved the experience and would like to ask that they cease and desist with the messages from the front desk explaining the lighting system or other items. Coming into the room after a long day and seeing the message light makes me think it's a family emergency only to hear a nice voice telling me about the master light switch. I should mention that Paul and the Acura service were stupendous and courteous. Bravo W, keep up the great work.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but problems with noise”
Reviews.Author: ose_2000
Reviews.Content: Rooms are really nice (stylish, clean, good in-room technology), but the hotel has serious problems with sound proofing. The hotel air-conditioning is relatively quite when turned off, but I can hear every single car passing on the street, the bass from the night club next door, and roof-top AC installations from the building next door (this is from a room on the back-side of the hotel). Also any noise from neighboring rooms or the hotel floor enters your room 100% unfiltered. Given that this is a new building and not exactly a low-cost hotel this is pretty disappointing. I am staying here for more than a week and unfortunately find myself forced to wear ear-plugs every night. Also, the Internet (both wireless and wired) is really slow. Even just loading up gmail takes time and doing anything a bit more data-intensive is really painful. (Internet is USD 17 per day, so I think guests can reasonably expect actual high-speed internet). I measured performance and never got more than 500 KBit/s.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but hotel overrated”
Reviews.Author: JudyBridge
Reviews.Content: Initial impressions of the hotel were very good. Excellent door staff, receptionists and concierges. Also a free car service for local trips, which was a nice surprise. What let it down badly was the room. Supposedly trendy design but not good at all to stay in: lighting in the bathroom abysmal; noisy air conditioning; room soundproofing generally poor so the train noise from outside was bad at night. And no fan in the loo! Also the room clearing wasn't great as not everything was cleared away (e.g. dirty mugs) and the shampoos/soap wasn't replenished. We also had trouble with the complimentary coffee/tea maker. When asked for a top up we got charged $10 room service for a glass of milk and tea for two! Finally the location was only good if you wanted somewhere equidistant from the town centre and shopping area, otherwise it would be better to choose nearer the main centre. Real shame as the staff were so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff = Happy Guest!”
Reviews.Author: limajt91279
Reviews.Content: Customer service can make or break a hotel and W Boston knows that good service is paramount. I stayed at the W Boston located on Stuart Street for two nights in October and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The staff was so friendly and genuine. They take the â€œWhatever, Wheneverâ€� motto very seriously at this property. The hotel is located in the Theatre District and is accessible to many of Bostonâ€™s tourist attractions. My wonderful king room was located on the 14th floor and had an â€œokâ€� view of downtown Boston. The room was decorated like most W Hotels: trendy and modern. Due to the hotels proximity to several night clubs, there are bouncers at the front door who request to see a key card upon entry late at night. It wasnâ€™t that big of a deal! My only qualm with the room was the numerous light switches making it difficult to turn off the lights at night. There was a disruption with the lifts but the entire staff rallied together to communicate to guests an alternate path to reach the freight elevator. My stay at the W Boston wasnâ€™t long but during my time there, I was very comfortable and satisfied with the service provided.

Reviews.Title: “Attempt at luxury but it comes up short...”
Reviews.Author: habs07
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night over Columbus weekend. The service was surly and there were a lot of frustrated people waiting for rooms at 4:00pm when we arrived. Thankfully, our room was ready though, so we didn't have too much interaction with the staff. Tried to tell the desk agent that we were in a rush to make it to dinner, but he insisted on telling us all about their night club for five minutes before letting us head off to the room. He literally said "Hold on, this is important" and went into the talk about how great their club/bar was and how we could get to the head of what would be a long line by showing our hotel key. The room was very modern and also was immaculately clean. The furnishings and fixtures, however, are very cheap. The furniture was of a quality that not even Ikea would stock; not quite what you expect for $400+ per night. Location, however, is great and it is always nice to stay at a new hotel. Would return if we got a deal, but certainly wouldn't be back for full price.

Reviews.Title: “Good, comfortable rooms but mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: walkingandeating
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went to the W Hotel in December of 2009. Overall, the rooms were nice and comfortable. However, the service was mediocre. The service definitely did not meet up to the standards of a W hotel and I would not recommend this hotel for someone staying in Boston. Rooms/Cleanliness The rooms were very comfortable with a modern, slightly minimalist style. However, they are a bit on the small side. The pillows, sheets, covers, and bed were extremely comfortable and what you would expect from a W hotel. The view was okay, overlooking the downtown Boston area. The entire hotel, including the rooms and hallways, had a nice fragrance due to the Alora Ambiance diffusers they used. However, upon checking in to our room, we noticed that the waste basket was full of dirty tissues. We called housekeeping and while they came within a few minutes, we were not impressed with this oversight in cleaning. Location The location is pretty decent. It's close to the Tremont green-line stop. It's a few minutes away walking from the Boston Commons. It's really close to Chinatown, if you're looking for Chinese food. However, the hotel isn't in the nicest of neighborhoods. While the area is clean and safe, it's not exactly the most aesthetically pleasing location. Service This is the one area where I really had a problem. I know the hotel is fairly new, but the service simply was not what I had expected from a W hotel. Right from the beginning, I knew something was wrong. The hotel has two sets of big glass doors, and when we approached, the doorman did not open the doors for us. In fact, throughout our stay, almost always, a doorman either was not present or did not open the doors for us. Even during the snowstorm, no one opened the doors and we had to pry open both doors. The staff at the front desk were a bit cold. No warm greeting, no welcome- just straight to business and giving us the room cards. The man at the front desk didn't explain any of the amenities or attractions of the hotel. He simply handed us the cards. More importantly, he asked us if we wanted parking. We told him that we didn't need parking. During check-out, he charged us for parking! We told him that we confirmed with him during check-in that we didn't get parking and also told him that we didn't even have a car. For his mistake, he made us wait 10 minutes while he went somewhere and checked. Finally, when I went home, the hotel charged me for a bag of nuts that I never touched. They refunded the money, but all of these little instances left a bad taste in my mouth. Ultimately, the smooth, "whatever whenever" service of the W hotels simply was not present at the W Hotel Boston. While certainly none of what I said would really amount to serious bad service, I would still rather spend my money on another 4-star hotel with better, warmer, competent service.

Reviews.Title: “Best cultural...historical and delicious city in the US!”
Reviews.Author: jppadgett
Reviews.Content: Fantastic fast and furious weekend with too many options to choose from> Love the Onyx hotel just a short walk from little Italy and the historic district Faneul Hall etc. Very friendly staff. Comfy beds and great contemporary decor. Dogs are welcome! Bus tour a must! No better time than September too! LOVE IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Beautiful Hotel... but VERY Loud. Not a place to Sleep”
Reviews.Author: j0j012345
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel is gorgeous. We travel a lot and have stayed in many different cities and countries. This is one of the more nicely appointed hotels we have visited. Guests are treated very well here; you rarely open a door and not a detail is overlooked. The guest room was tastefully decorated and our kids liked how modern it was (except for the see-through screen into the bathroom). The room was very clean. Only one complaint: YOU WON"T SLEEP here, especially on a weekend evening. The proximity to the busy downtown means that this hotel is LOUD!. The emergency vehicles going at all hours of the night (as expected) and the full glass wall on one end of the room mean that there is little to cushion the noise. Saturday night we slept very little. Oh... and the ridiculous party women (thanks room 625!) who had no common courtesy and ran through the halls screaming at 2am. I wanted to love the hotel. It was beautiful, great location for sightseeing, wonderful service and kind people but I won't ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, typical W rooms but lousy service..”
Reviews.Author: Mikenyc_10
Reviews.Content: Very much the scene of a W hotel with the hip vibe and velvet rope. Typical funky rooms with comfy beds and good amenities. Our room did smell a little funky though. Great location. BAD service - did not have additional name on room, room service very slow (45 minutes for only a pot of coffee), elevator broken, took them a day to bring the bottle of champagne pre-ordered and only after being prompted, room not cleaned until 3pm when we left at 10am. 3 guys working front door, but no help with luggage, or opening the 2nd set of doors! Look elsewhere until they get there act together. Starwood Gold member for 10 years and far cry from that type of service

Reviews.Title: “W for WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Honest_Experiences
Reviews.Content: Really cool, young, funky hotel. Amazing food, great location. VERY clean, great views. You can call staff at anytime and ask for anything 'whatever whenever' is their moto and they actually mean it!

Reviews.Title: “Not My Thing, Trying Too Hard To Be Trendy.”
Reviews.Author: The007Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for one night on business. When I arrived by cab, the doorman followed me from the cab to the front desk (carrying one light bag that I told him I did not need help with) and stood next to me until he received a tip. The check in process was quick, I reserved a king bed, but was given two double beds. I asked for a king and was told that there were none available that day. The room was filled with ultra modern items. The alarm clock was impossible to use if you did not bring your iPod, which I did not, and the lighting was weird. There were two switches on the wall, one that turned on every light in the room and another that did nothing. You need to turn on all the overhead lights in the room in order to turn on the bathroom lights. This is probably because of the "peeper" art on the wall between the bathroom and bedroom. It would allow you to see someone in the bathroom from the bedroom through the screen painting on the wall if the lights were only on in the bathroom. If you are travelling with friends or family, this could be very annoying. The hotel may be loved by the trendy crowd that likes odd and uncomfortable. I prefer functional, comfortable and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “My daughter and I just spent three...”
Reviews.Author: amateurhistorian
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just spent three wonderful nights at the W in Boston. She used her Starwoodnpoints to upgrade us to a spacious, well-appointed double room with a great view of the city. We particularly enjoyed the in-room DVD player, the inventive cocktails and hip atmosphere of the lobby bar, the resident spa (Bliss!!!) and an amazing dinner at Market Restaurant. At the risk of being redundant, I have to say that the room design leaves A LOT to be desired! The lighting in the bathroom is completely inadequate, you cannot turn on the bathroom light in the middle of the night without waking your roomie, there were too few towels, and the see-through screen between bathroom and bedroom is just plain inexcusable. Oddly, we'd stay there again: the "pluses" are that good! (I am a huge fan on the Nine Zero Kimpton hotel in Boston, so would have to do some serious comparison shopping...)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and swanky hotel in beantown”
Reviews.Author: lbznyc603
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Wonderful King - nice size room and comfortable. Bed was amazing, as all W's seem to be. Only set back was the location. The hotel borders a sketch area, especially at night. One block you're from the Commons, but one block in the other direction and you're holding onto your purse. I was suprised the W picked this location, but I suppose the area is "up and coming" so maybe it won't be like this for much longer. Room was fairly cleaned, but found plastic bags from previous guest and a wash cloth in between the wall and dresser. Both those things were there the entire visit, along with the iron board and iron that I had used Friday night. I am a clean freak, I'll freely admit, but I don't think it's much to expect a thoroughly cleaned room. I booked an in-room massage with Bliss for when I arrived and it was excellent. Probably one of the best massages I've ever had. I also booked services at Bliss and they were outstanding. Definitely highly recommend that spa/in-room services. HD TV in room was nice, but all movies, "just missed tv," and music all had to be paid for. Was a bit annoying, but you don't go away to watch tv right? Unless you're entertaining kids... Bouncer-like concierge guarding the hotel at night is annoying. I'm not sure why people stand on line to hang out at the hotel lobby bar, I don't see it as being such a hip/swanky place, but maybe it is for Boston. There should be a separate entrance for guests so you don't need to get death stares when you're walking to the head of the line trying to get into your hotel for the nigh. Overall, nice, relaxing, and pleasant stay so all the borderline issues were easily erased from memory. Would recommend for singles/young couples/girls/guys weekend away. Not a family place or an older persons retreat by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Privacy and Lighting "complaints" right on the money but overall, great place.”
Reviews.Author: SherryL48
Reviews.Content: Everything said previousely about the lighting, which was VERY BADLY DESIGNED, is true. Too dim and flourescent, cannot turn on bathroom light without turning on other lights and bothering whomever else may be trying to sleep. Privacy if showering - not so good - hopefully you're traveling with a spouse or significant other or be prepared - if they want the light on in the bathroom while showering you can see right through the art installation that serves as a barrier between bedroom and outer bathroom area. Small things like that - bath towels are above the toilet which is in a separate room from the shower - plan ahead. No coffee pot in the room - that is tough for those of us that need coffee to get ready in the morning.
