There was a noise problem at 3 am but after calling downstairs it was taken care of in less than 10 minutes. Staff very helpful, friendly and courteous. The beds are FABULOUSLY comfortable. The location is great - within walking disstance of almost everything - 25 minute walk to the Long Wharf - Aquarium area. Everything else is closer. It's right in the theater district so if you're there for a show it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful honeymoon thanks to the W!”
Reviews.Author: HessandSimon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were planning our honeymoon and were looking online for pricing to stay at the W. I came across what ended up being an admin error on the W's part, and found a room for $32/night, which should have been $320. We booked it for three nights at that rate, and the total came to just over $100US. I called to confirm since it seemed to good to be true, and the yadmitted that that price was an error on their part, but that they had to honour it. We were beyond excited. Then, a few days before our departure, we called again to confirm, and the rates had been raised to their normal rates without our knowing. After forwarding to the hotel's manager our confirmation email proving the total price we were quoted originally, they offered us a room upgrade, and offered a comprimise - our first night would be $149, and the next two nights would be complimentary. Outstanding customer service! So we arrived expecting that they may treat us not as well as the other guests since we were staying there for so much less, but it was not the case at all. The lady that works the front desk is AMAZING, very very kind and welcoming, and the room was really great - wall to wall windows! There were many other touches along the way that blew us away even more, but to sum up, I would highly recommend the W Boston. It was the best hotel we have stayed at, and the customer service was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent sleep”
Reviews.Author: BusterCT1K
Reviews.Content: I slept extremely well and as a SPG gold member was upgraded to a very nice cool corner room. The a/c ran continuously and provided BOTH cooling and heating -- important for the warm days and unseasonably cool nights of late summer (W Seattle are you listening?). The room was well designed, fashion-forward, and made me feel like special efforts had been taken in design. The translucent screen separating the bathroom from the rest of the room would have been bothersome if any degree of privacy was desired between traveling companions, but as a solo traveler I was not bothered. I might not, however, choose to come here with a romantic partner. The bed was magnificent and the large screen TV provided fairly good entertainment options but no HBO! On the night of the season finale of True Blood! After all, it's only the hippest show of 2010. Instead they have "Showtime." Lame. A W should have both -- this is not a Four Points. Service, as at many W hotels, is generally weak and cool (rather than warm and friendly), though efficient. Free wifi in the lounge is good; delicious macaroons and mini apple tarts were available on the two afternoons I was there. The gym is small, and while they have most of the usual hotel gym machines you will need, the strength-training machines need more lubrication. Solid 4/5 rating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location with average service”
Reviews.Author: Patsters
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, like every W hotel. The rooms are very convenient in size. Besides the fact that W hotels are a bit overbranded and try to sell everything "Ã  la carte" it's still a charming room. Reception desk staff was very helpfull and even got us a nice surprise for our anniversary. Nice gesture. The concierge were very average. They had trouble suggesting anything but their own restaurant and when we insisted they gave us general directions without really helping us out. They guided us as if we new the city very well, wich we didn't. The bad part is the restaurant. The service for breakfast was terrible, we waited for 45 mins to get the food, they forgot all the sides we asked for and that took another 10. Anyway nice hotel, great location, very clean but avoid the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad lighting.”
Reviews.Author: joebug53
Reviews.Content: The W is very nice, has great service, clean rooms, but bad lighting. The lighting is the only problem because there is a main switch that turns on a main light over the bed, the problem is that you can't have the main light off and have other lights on. Other wise I had a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pw9999
Reviews.Content: Hotel styled for young single adults. Dark tile and room decor, but fairly large rooms. There was an unusual attribute in our room wherein you could not turn on the bathroom light without having the main room light on. This wouldn't be a problem if you are traveling alone, but when you are with someone, it make life a little more complicated. The hotel had a unique feature of being able to drive guests around in an Acura, which we took to Fenway Park and the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, quiet room”
Reviews.Author: favenmarg
Reviews.Content: We booked through priceline and this was a great deal. We stayed at the W on a Sunday night. We asked for a quiet room and were given a lovely room on the top floor, far away from the elevator. The hotel location is great and the staff were professional.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: rockymtnlobo
Reviews.Content: We took a family trip to Boston with teenagers and we all loved the hotel's location. Very close to the Boston Common and several great restaurants across the street. The hotel is very nice and has a modern decor. The downstairs bar is a trendy, hot spot and we felt a bit out of place when walking through the lobby. Definitely a hotel for the young and hip, and not the family/tourist crowd. But, we appreciated the amenities and the great location. And the price was definitely right too! One of the best deals we found in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off!”
Reviews.Author: CemBoston
Reviews.Content: We reserved a ball room for about 150 people for a top ranked business school event. We were charged $90/person and all the hotel had to do was to supply the room, food and drinks. The food was no better than cold fried chicken, old fries and tiny little burgers that tasted worse than tofu. I am really not exaggerating! Moreover, the food was just not enough; towards the middle of the event we were trying to salvage crumbs from trays as we were starving. The staff also started charging for drinks after a couple of hours. This was also a surprise though it was probably part of the deal we had cut. My point is $90 does not cover even drinks in full. I am deeply insulted and feel cheated by this hotel. I raised my concern to the management via email before writing this review. Of course I got no response from anyone. I will proactively discourage anyone from doing business with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't live up to W standards”
Reviews.Author: sdelmonte
Reviews.Content: After staying at the W in midtown Atlanta, we changed our reservation in Boston to the W. We were surprised to find the newer hotel in Boston not quite up to standards. A few things that bugged us are: our shower door was broken so water leaked on floor, my boyfriend had ordered flowers to be delivered to our room to surprise me and they were forgotten, he had to go down and get them. One day our room was not cleaned. After two phone calls (two too many), ladies were sent up. But without cleaning carts. I left the room to let them work and came back to dirty glasses, no replacement glasses/stemware, no tidying and trash still left out. A huge disappointment! Also, the fitness center left much to be desired, especially compared to the ATL W. However, our welcome ambassador, Noah, was very helpful and even gave us a complimentary bottle of wine upon our arrival. The hotel rectified the room situation with a bottle of wine & free dessert & movie. Overall, we love W and plan to stay at the one in Manhattan this weekend and again in Atlanta in October. The one in Boston just left us a little disappointed, especially for the money we spent. It had only been open 9 months and still seem to be working out their kinks.

Reviews.Title: “customer service so terrible I never even got to book a room”
Reviews.Author: skidog88
Reviews.Content: Called the new W Boston to book a WOW suite for a specail anniversary. Got the run around from reservation clerk who tranferred me to someone else. That person told me to "hang on as the phone is ringing off the hook"- I waited for about 5 minutes when he returned he told me he couldn't reserve a WOW suite without going to corporate sales? On hold again, he came back and said could he call me back. Unbelievable. He NEVER called me back. This am I called and spoke to the W Boston, hotel reservations manager and he barely appologized. That is it for the W- what horrid service. I have booked at the Four Seasons instead.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel. Overzealous Bouncer.”
Reviews.Author: LocoOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: The new W Boston is just gorgeous. It is probably the most spacious W Iâ€™ve ever stayed at in terms of room size. My room had a great view, and the location was excellent. And as always, the bed is just fantastic! Overall, the staff was great and I was even able to score a ride with the Acura Experience to Stephanieâ€™s on Newbury for brunch. The only concern I have with the W Boston is the set-up of the main entrance to the hotel in the evenings (at least on the Saturday night during my stay). The W Boston seems to have a popular lounge frequented by trendsetters. It is to be expected, right? It is the W. But what I didnâ€™t appreciate was the fact that the main entrance, which is relatively small, was now roped off with a red velvet rope with a bouncer/security scrutinizing the lounge goersâ€™ appearance and style and checking their IDâ€™s. This was my first jaunt to Boston, and I planned a very casual evening, since I was only there overnight. At around 10PM I exited the W wearing Ralph Lauren linen shorts with a Ben Sherman t-shirt. Probably not the attire to wear to the W Boston lounge apparently, but for my purposes that evening it suited me just fine. I waited to the right of the main entrance, about 5-10 feet away, while waiting for a friend to meet me, and the bouncer stationed at the door kept looking at me while I waited with a condescending look on his face. Finally after a few minutes, the bouncer called over to me, and with a cold and demeaning attitude asked me: â€œCan I help you? Are you looking for something?â€� As if my presence to the right of the main entrance, was causing an issue for the Wâ€™s image and I wasnâ€™t worthy to be standing near the hotel. I honestly was caught off guard, and after a minute I responded by reminding the bouncer that I was a guest. Regardless if I was a guest or not, the W (Starwood) management should certainly offer better sensitivity training to their staff, including bouncers/security stationed at the door. W Boston should also evaluate if having the main entrance to the hotel roped off in the evening to serve both as the lounge entrance and entrance for hotel guests to enter the hotel is the most ideal situation. The experience left a bad impression for what otherwise was a great stay at what I know to be a fabulous hotel brand and wonderful room. Iâ€™ll return, but will definitely keep my eye out for the overly zealous bouncers at the door, and kindly remind them of their manners.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hotel with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: mrg0137
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W Boston with my family for two nights during a sightseeing trip to Boston. It was our first time staying at a W, and without a doubt, it was a unique experience, one that both impressed and surprised us. Although it is repeatedly mentioned in reviews of the W, anyone thinking of staying here should be aware that it is a trendy hotel. Everything is modern and edgy, and the rooms, while lovely, have a couple of features that are simply uncomfortable for many people. The goal of the W is to be hip, young, trendy, etc. My twenty-year-old son enthusiastically loved everything about the hotel. It seems to be marketed to 20-somethings with money to burn on an expensive hotel room. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay here, and it is one of the nicer places Iâ€™ve ever stayed. The level of service provided is top notch, and truly differentiates it. Some things were a little odd, but the good heavily outweighs the bad. The location of the W is good, within two blocks of Boston Common and the Public Gardens, as well as in the heart of the small Boston theatre district. Itâ€™s not the most beautiful neighborhood in Boston, but it is fine, perfectly safe, and the W itself definitely improves the local area. There arenâ€™t a ton of full-service restaurants or shopping within walking distance of the hotel, but there are a few, and there is a Starbucks and Dunkinâ€™ Donuts across the street from the hotel, as well as some sort of food court in the transportation building across the street. Finding a normal sit-down restaurant is a slight challenge around here, but we didnâ€™t find it to be a problem, or mind walking a few blocks, since Boston is such an easy walking city. The hotel itself is a new, modern high-rise, but donâ€™t expect to be up at the top. The hotel occupies the first 15 floors, with the rest being the W Residences. We arrived very early for check-in, around 8:00 am, and were welcomed very nicely by the valet staff. (Valet parking is $44 per night). Every time we entered or exited the hotel for anything, we always found there to be at least a few people ready and waiting to open the doors for us, welcome us to the hotel, etc. I donâ€™t think anyone in my family ever opened the front door of the hotel themselves. There was always someone there to do it for us. The hotel lobby is very nice, with lots of seating areas, all with modern furniture and decorated in tones of blue and gray. There were large walls of windows in the lobby overlooking the street in front of the hotel, which made it very pleasant during the day. At night, the lobby, which has a bar as its centerpiece, becomes more like a nightclub than a hotel lobby. There is loud music playing, people of various ages all over the place, and a general lack of the calm and serenity that you can experience during the day! We felt a little uncomfortable walking back into the hotel at night, and would quickly run over to the elevators to retreat to our room. For some people, the lively bar scene would be appreciated, but for a family, it wasnâ€™t so desirable. As we expected, there werenâ€™t any rooms available to check into so early when we arrived, but the front desk staff was very courteous and welcoming anyway. She saw that one room had recently been vacated of the type we had reserved, and offered to put a rush on it for cleaning. She also immediately offered to take our luggage to hold until the room was ready, and took our cell phone number to call when the room was ready. We never actually received a call during the day letting us know that the room was ready, but it didnâ€™t matter to us since we were busy touring all day, and had really only wanted to drop off our luggage and car in the first place. There was always a bowl of apples available at the front desk, as well as complimentary fruit-infused water or coffee depending on the time of day. When we checked in later and went up to our room, we were a bit confused, as you have to insert your room key in the elevator to get to any room floor. It wonâ€™t go anywhere if you donâ€™t. The room that we had (1401) was designated a â€œMega Roomâ€�, which corresponds to an upgrade from the standard â€œWonderful Roomâ€�. The mega room was supposed to be a larger corner room, and it definitely was. The room was huge, especially for a city! It had lots of open space, both in the entrance to the room, as well as by the beds. It felt like an upscale loft apartment. There were walls of windows on two sides of the room, which overlooked the local area. The view from the hotel isnâ€™t overly remarkable, just average areas of the city, but it was so nice to have so many windows to keep the room light and bright. It was also nice at night to stay in the room with the windows open overlooking the lights of the city. The room dÃ©cor is very modern, in tones of white, dark blue, gray, and black. Our room had 2 queen beds, which were very comfortable, with white duvets, featherbeds, and plush pillows. There was a desk with a comfortable chair, and one chair with an ottoman. One thing I would recommend is that the hotel put more furniture in the larger rooms like ours. Our room, although quite a bit larger than the average room, didnâ€™t really seem to have any extra furniture. It left the room looking a bit bare in some parts. However, the mega room was well-worth the upgrade for the corner location, space, and windows. There are lots of nice features in the rooms, which especially appeal to a younger crowd, such as an iPod dock and 14 or 16 cell phone chargers (one for each type of cell phone). There was a flat screen HDTV, along with a DVD player. All of the features in the room were well thought out and useful. However, everything couldnâ€™t be perfectly normal, in typical W style! The issue that we had came with the bathroom. The bathroom fixtures themselves were lovely. The bathroom was large, with nice marble floors, a beautiful tub/shower, and sink area with upgraded Bliss Spa toiletries that we loved. The toilet is in its own room within the bathroom. However, as seems to be common with W Hotels, there was a lack of privacy in the bathroom. The wall between the bathroom and the bedroom has a large hole cut out of it, with a piece of artwork on a screen hung over it. On the bedroom side of the screen, there is a picture of some trees, and on the bathroom side, the sink mirror hangs in front of part of the screen, with a Thoreau poem written on the rest. At first glance, this seemed different, and somewhat interesting, to have a screen between the bedroom and bathroom, rather than a full wall. However, when the lights are turned on in the bathroom at all, it becomes see-through, so that everyone in the room can see right into the bathroom and vice versa. I just donâ€™t really see the point of having a see-through screen between the bedroom and bathroom, especially to see in from the bedroom to the bathroom. It ended up giving a lack of privacy, which some of our family found uncomfortable. It was a shame because it detracted from an otherwise beautiful bathroom. I believe that internet in the room was $15 in the room, but there is free internet available in the lobby/bar area. You can connect to the wireless down there for free for an hour at a time, and I realized that it would still work in our room after making the initial connection downstairs. I saw a lot of people clustered in the lobby area by the elevators trying to use the internet, but it was nice to be able to connect for free, and then take my laptop back up to the room for the rest of the hour and continue to use it for free. For some people, having to do that wouldnâ€™t be worth it, but I thought it was worth it to avoid paying. A lot of the little things at the W are definitely unconventional as well, such as wallpaper on the ceiling in the elevator waiting areas that is a collage of pictures of eyes, which appear to be looking at you from above as you wait. In the hallways, there are pictures on the walls of men looking through hedges, effectively looking like theyâ€™re peeking into the rooms. We generally found these touches to be fun and different, but for the very traditional person, theyâ€™d be uncomfortable, just as we found the bathroom set-up uncomfortable. Staying at the W is all about your personal comfort level, and what you find acceptable. The designers of the hotel push the envelope with everything, in an appeal to a younger crowd. Despite the odd eccentricities of this hotel, the little touches definitely did make it special. These include things like the doormen always available to open the doors and welcome us to the hotel, as well as the carpets in the lobby and elevators that are changed throughout the day to read â€œGood Morningâ€� â€œGood Afternoonâ€� and â€œGood Eveningâ€�. Pillows on the beds in the room are changed by the maids to read either â€œWelcomeâ€� or â€œSweet Dreamsâ€� depending on the time of day. Service is also excellent. We asked the maid for a few extra bath products to take home, since we love the Bliss items, and she left tons of everything for us on the last day. We were expecting just a couple extra bottles of shampoo maybe, but she left lots of everything for us. A true testament to service at the W came at check-out. We were out in the morning on our last day, and on our way back in before check-out, we stopped to ask the valet to get the car, while we went up to our room to get our things. We figured that would give plenty of time to have our car waiting when we got down. When we came back downstairs and checked out about half an hour later, the car still hadnâ€™t been brought up. We waited and waited, and still nothing. We were getting annoyed, but without saying anything, an employee (not sure if he was a manager or not) came over and noticed that we had been standing with our luggage for a while. He asked if we needed anything at all, and when we mentioned that we had been waiting for our car for a long time, he took action immediately. He reprimanded the valet staff, and the car was up within a minute or two. He apologized multiple times, as did other staff who werenâ€™t even involved, like those at the front desk, and he had the parking charge for the day removed from our bill immediately. Although the long wait for parking wasnâ€™t ideal, the way that the situation was handled was amazing. Without asking for anything, the staff realized a mistake had been made, took action, and helped us as best they could as quickly as possible. Even though we left after having waited an hour for our car to be brought up, we left happy with the service at the W. At the end of the day, the W is really a beautiful hotel. It is new, fresh, and upscale. The room we had was beautiful and immaculate at all times, and the staff is some of the best we have ever encountered at a hotel for its attentiveness and level of service. I found the hotel to be a little too hip for what I wanted, and it clearly appeals strongly to a younger crowd. I would consider staying at a W again, but I would want to find one with a more private bathroom. Weâ€™re usually Westin fans, and the W offers everything Westin does in terms of great beds, calming rooms, etc., but with a twist. The service was better at the W, so itâ€™s a toss-up for which chain weâ€™d choose in the future. Just be aware that the W is going to be different from your average hotel, both in ways you may want, like great service, and in some ways you may not want, like a nightclub-esque lobby and lack of privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and stylish hotel - HIGHLY recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Parsely115
Reviews.Content: After our first stay at the W Boston, enough great things can't be said! Oustanding location super close to tonnes of restaurants + a block from the park. Really friendly service. Our room we LOVED. Not just your standard hotel room. Beautiful shaded glass sliding door for the bathroom, cool artwork, comfortable bed + pillows. Lots of neat added touches. The room wasn't huge, but not small either. I can find no negative comments to make - other than if you're traveling with young kids -- it's not really a "family" hotel. With the very trendy club on the 1st floor, and style of the hotel -- better for singles and couples v. family. One last important thing: the restaurant is INCREDIBLE. Order the Amish chicken simply cooked. I have never eaten such delicious food.

Reviews.Title: “The W Hotel Boston is truly WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: Jess921_10
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the new W Hotel in Boston with girlfriends and we had a wonderful time. The location is perfect, the staff (also referred to as 'talent') were all so kind and helpful, and the room was beautiful. Thank you to the W for making our "girls weekend" that much more enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “unparalleled customer service and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: ReikiTerri
Reviews.Content: The staff at the W Boston was incredible - Particularly LeighAnne from Whatever Whenever, who took the time to put together such a unique welcome for us in our room that we were overwhelmed and literally speechless. She noted from our booking phone conversation the name of the particular musician we were coming to see, and had a video of one of his new songs playing on a laptop, with a nice note when we entered the room. The attention to detail and the motivation to orchestrate something so simple and yet so meaningful to us made this our favorite hotel stay ever. Really!! She also upgraded our room to a higher floor and left us a little surprise for our 10th Anniversary. We'll be back again the next time we're in Boston - incredible. Thank you LeighAnne!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: KevinDowney
Reviews.Content: Recently my partner and I took a weekend trip to Boston. We find weekend get aways our way of chasing off the busy work life stress. From the moment we arrived at the curb the level of quialty service began. As we entered into the reception area.. we were immediately greeted by a warm professional woman ( Jen ) Jen's attitude and knowledge were truely outstanding .. her desire to help and make us feel welcomed and taken care of sincerely more than i have experienced in a hotel in a while. (we travel to NYC and Chicago and Florida and the list goes on... ) she really put an unexpected smile on my face... not always and easy task to do..Our room was great ...linens ,pillows , cleanliness all outstanding...now on the cleanliness side.. I mean very clean.. lol Once we arrived to our room the bags were delivered quickly and the bell man again was very polite and professional... after a long journey it was time to head downstairs for a cocktail. Well that is where we met JOE the bartender. folks if you run a customer serivice business Jen and Joe are people you want on your team.Joe greeted us quickly and again with a warm and welcoming and friendly approach... ( what we all expect but not always find ). Joes mixology skills were outstanding and he prepared us a w hotel special cocktail that was just what the doc ordered.. beyond his skill as a bartender his knowledge of Boston and his company was awesome. I think more than the knowledge and professionalism that we expericenced what came to my mind was... Here is a facility/ mangement group that understands the need to make their employees feel very much a part of their business... for them take ownership and pride in caring for their clients / customers. I hope that is the case here .. regardelss my hat is off to Jen and Joe for sure... When we return to boston I know for sure where we will be staying !!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but stylish with great service”
Reviews.Author: Travellingbug07
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I decided to spend the tail end of our 4th of July holiday in Boston and fortunately our $134 Priceline bid for one night in the Back Bay area was accepted by the W Boston. The W Boston is on the edge of the Back Bay area and is only a couple of blocks from Boston Common, which was convenient as we wanted to walk the Freedom Trail, which includes Boston Common as well as other historical sights close to the hotel. This was our first stay at a W hotel and were quite pleased with our hotel experience - check-in was fast and efficient, and the concierge quickly confirmed a massage appointment that evening. In order to accomodate the in-room massage request, we were given a very large corner room on the top floor (although I should also state that I'm a Starwood Preferred Gold member, so my membership may have also helped snag the room upgrade). Unlike some other reviewers, we didn't find the room configuration too unusual - we resolved the less than optimal lighting in the bathroom and my girlfriend's back problem by moving a light fixture and the ottoman next to the sink. Also, we didn't find the staff too hip for us or encounter any attitude - on the contrary, everyone (from the doorman, to the check-in staff, the bellhop, the concierge, the room service staff, and the hotel's Acura driver) were very professional, helpful, and friendly. Of course, being reasonably dressed and groomed, being polite, smiling, saying thank you, and providing appropriate tips always helps. We ordered room service for dinner and breakfast and while it was pricey, we really enjoyed the Jean-Georges Vongerichten menu - especially the fact that the W Boston accomodated all of my girlfriend's gluten-free diet needs, including a request for almond milk for her hot chocolate at breakfast. The services that the W Boston offers that we really enjoyed were 1) the flexibility to accomodate gluten-free menu requests, 2) the one-way ride in an Acura within a few miles of the hotel, 3) free wi-fi in the lobby, and 4) late check-out (4PM, as we had a late flight back to San Francisco). We also liked that there was a gym (which unfortunately we did not use due to our busy schedule). The Acura service would have been perfect if the W Boston offered round-trips and not just one-way trips, and it would have been nice if the free wi-fi was also offered in the room, but all in all our stay was an outstanding value, and we will definitely consider staying at the W Boston again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but well suited for business travel”
Reviews.Author: traveler60601
Reviews.Content: Very similar to most W Hotels, a brand that admittedly can be a little over the top sometimes with the "hip" atmosphere they try to cultivate, but I found a very agreable balance here. If you do not like the W "style" then you won't like this either unfortunately, but I did find it kept to a fairly reasonable level here. Beautiful and comfortable room, all the bells and whistles, and an excellent fitness room. Great location and an excellent Jean Georges Vongrichten estaurant connected to the hotel. I will return!

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: eh1318
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this new W hotel last march. The exterior was stunning. The door ambassador was very nice opening the door for me. Attention to detail everywhere. (The RUGS change according to the time of day- Good Morning, Good Afternoon, and Good Evening) The lounge was very nice with the dim lighting at night. I had my dog with me so when I got in my room I had a Dog bed, Food, Treats, and Toys all waiting for me. Very nice corner room with views of the financial district. I went to Market, which I should say was very delicious French food. Large gym with all the best equipment. Oh and the legendary W Bed. Just a WOW experience. Definitely Recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; Excellent Service; Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: lilkimsobe
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston for Celtics game. Chris, the W's "Welcome Ambassador", welcomed us to Boston and The W in style. My 10 yr old son is a HUGE Celtics fan & we mentioned to Chris that we had flown up from Miami just for the game. After checking us into our room, Chris returned shortly thereafter with a Celtics foam finger as a surprise. We were so touched and appreciative of this genuine gesture on Chris' part. It was one of the things my son said he wanted when we got to The Garden. Chris' hospitality did not end there. When we returned to our room later that evening, there was a welcome gift with snacks and drinks. It's this kind of service that confirms the W Boston as a top hotel. My son said next time we go to Boston, he wants to stay at The W again. That's a done deal.

Reviews.Title: “Usually not a W-hotel fan”
Reviews.Author: PHCDK
Reviews.Content: Good location and fun lobby, bar is great with good cocktails. The gym at this hotel is pretty nice and very suitable for most business travellers (not as good as St. Regis SF). Rooms are nice for a W-hotel and bathroom offer more privacy than other W-hotels I have stayed at such as Phoenix). Rooms are good size with amazing beds as usual for Starwood.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: aml3679
Reviews.Content: Surprised my husband for his birthday with a weekend in Boston. Took a chance and used Hotwire for the first time - got a room here for about $200 a night (regular rack rate is $385). My husband loves modern and I am more traditional - the rooms are nice but more to his taste than mine. There was a king size bed with a goose down duvet and pillows - very comfortable. There was built in reading lights on the headboard which were very convenient. A huge flat screen plasma TV. The bathroom had a nice glass enclosed walk in shower. The toilet was had it's own room which I love. The bathroom was private but when the lights were on - you can see through to the bedroom because the huge painting separating the two areas became transparent. The room came with everything you could ever need. Nice toiletries, plenty of fluffy white towels, bathrobes, a large closet with plenty of hangers, a safe, magazines, there was a stocked mini bar and refrigerator (we did not use anything - sorry, $10 for oreos - out of the question - especially since there was a 7-11 across the street where you could get them for 99 cents). The service was top notch. They changed the welcome mats all over 3 times a day to say good morning, good afternoon and good evening. They played music according to what time of day it was. There were curteous and professional door men. We had a problem with the AC the first night and they came right up to fix it. It is in the theater district so perfect for a show. Stay on a higher floor as the bottom floors tend to be louder because of the nightclub.

Reviews.Title: “W Standards great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 55UK12
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in Boston, Loved the hotel staff very good Would return enjoyed the romo service Lounge staff friendly Great area will return

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but pricey”
Reviews.Author: hcchloe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Hotel Boston June 9th-13th. Very nice hotel. However be aware you will not receive SPG points if you book through priceline (I'm assuming the other online travel sites as well). I didnt have any issues with noise at night like others had written in their reviews. But i do agree the lighting was odd along with the see through curtain to the bathroom. Overall great hotel but way too pricey.

Reviews.Title: “VIP Quality”
Reviews.Author: stua0500
Reviews.Content: We felt like VIPs during our entire stay. Staff and hotel are fabulous! Location was perfect - we walked everywhere. I was really nervous about bringing our dog but everyone made him feel at home. He enjoyed his doggie amenities. The dog park around the corner was awesome - we never would have found it or even thought to ask about it. And it was one of the first things the doorman told my boyfriend when we arrived - very thoughtful! We really appreciated the information. It's nice to see such impeccable customer service and hospitality! It certainly sets W apart from the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but some Issues”
Reviews.Author: nadia759
Reviews.Content: Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the W. The views aren't the greatest, but the location is nice - close to chinatown, Boston Common, and the theater district. The room was very modern and comfortable. The shower is open, so if you are staying with friends in the room and are not comfortable with that, then you might want to look elsewhere...I stayed by myself, so it was fine. The toilet, thankfully, was in a separate room. My complaints: - The valet dude didn't seem to initially believe that I was staying at the W when I pulled up in my rental Kia (not my fault that I have to rent an economy car while on business). He was about to tell me that I had to move my car, when I interruped him and said I had a reservation. Not a huge deal, but regardless... - The front desk forgot to give me a wakeup call one morning. They were very apologetic and offered me free full breakfast, which was nice. But really, at this calibre of hotel, that's inexcusable. - The computer in the lobby which was there so guests could print out their boarding passes wasn't working. I tried for 10 minutes before I had to rush to the airport. Once again, not a huge deal, but... Overall, I'd stay here again if on business...

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Theater District”
Reviews.Author: mlizBoston
Reviews.Content: Brand new, clean, contemporary. Meets expectations of a W hotel. Decent location in the city, especially for theater. Not outstanding if you are looking for a hotel with a great view. Very good service. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, some improvements could be made”
Reviews.Author: KK10016
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W and overall enjoyed my stay. The staff were very friendly and the room was very nice. I think the rooms could be improved with some better lighting and the doors slam very loudly. I ordered room service twice and both times several things were left out and I had to call back to have them brought to the room. It was also a surprise that the wall between the bedroom and bathroom was transparent when the lights are on; not ideal when you're staying with friends. Overall, though, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at W Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dlg222
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the W Hotel in Boston , Mass for my birthday celebrate. We travel for busines and had heard only good reviews about W Hotels. From the moment we made our reservation we knew we were in for a fabulous experience. We arrived on May 11. We were greeted from Steve one of the door ambassador and we knew that we had made the correct choice. He was so pleasant. Wonderful job ethics. Steve escorted us to check in...hotel lobby is outstanding.We were greeted by Jessica. My husband and I are spg members and I had called prior to our arrival to request an upgrade, Both Tom and Andrew assured me that they would do their best to accomodate our request. Jessica told us that we were upgraded to a cool corner room.She also asked us what took us to the W Hotel. We mentioned my birthday celebration. Our room was so beautiful!! We went out for lunch and when we returned to our room we were surprised by a note from Jessica ..A Happy Birthday note with 2 complimentary sips at the W Lounge The W lounge is one of the best looking lounges we have ever been to in Boston. Service was unbelievable. Upon our check out we were once again greeted by Jessica. We could not thank her enough for our stay. The gentleman who retrieved our car was also so pleasant. Cannot wait for our next stay..our anniversary in Oct I hope. Thanks again to the entire staff. Lucy and Don Hooksett, NH

Reviews.Title: “W Boston Reminds Starwood Fans what a W Stay Should be like”
Reviews.Author: Javs72
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the W Boston for a weekend getaway, and below are my comments written to the GM at the hotel recognizing his and his team's efforts for a wonderful stay: Just wanted to say thank you for a wonderful stay this past weekend at the W Boston, and for the personalized welcome card and chocolates you sent. We thought the hotel was a beautiful property, but what stood out was the exexplary service that we have come to know among most W properties. From the pleasant greetings to opening doors upon arrival and the helpful, enthusiastic responses on every request, we left feeling and knowing that your management and team help set the standard for service. I have had a very different experience recently at one of your W Hotel neighbors a few hours down I-95 where management and service were less than adequate and did little to resolve my disappointment. I say that only to point out that the experience we had overall in Boston reminded me of what the W stands for and I appreciate that. Again, I just wanted to say thank for a wonderful stay that stood out enough for me to take the time to write and recognize your team. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect ambassador of the W concept. If you like the W style, this hotel is for you”
Reviews.Author: Ultraplur
Reviews.Content: My stay at this W hotel was a clear reminder of all that W stands for. Not only was the bar a hot-spot every night, from Monday through Sunday, where some of the nicest people in town would show up (and show-off) and the restaurant be a truly delightful gourmet experience, but you are also constantly reinforced rock-star status from the moment you check-in to the moment when you open your room door and see the "wow". Of course, the W is not for everyone, as neither is the Ritz Carlton or the Peninsula. The W is trendy, chic and, above all, sexy. It is a musical hotel, with all planned to a fantastic stay. The hotel's gym is nice, but could have been larger and better equipped. The rooms were amongst the roomiest that I have tried at any W in the world. The only drawbacks of this W are its location and lack of view. With so many hotels with water views in Boston, the W really lacks a sexy view to complement its style. It is not sexy to look into an old dusty office building. Also, it is not sexy to walk into abandoned streets in the outskirts of China town. I hope that the presence of the W starts to bring better tenants into the neighborhood. The W is a 5 minutes walk to the Boston Commons and 10 minutes to the financial district. 15 minutes to Atlantic avenue and 20 minutes to Columbus park. Not the best location for sure, however, if you rent a bicycle (which you should) the Whatever Whenever staff will store it for you overnight, no problem, and you will be able to get anywhere in just 3 to 7 minutes. If you are in Boston for partying, this is the hotel for you. If you are musical, a rock-star or live like one, look no further. If your fare is 5 o'clock tea and a peaceful library, look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “First Time at W Boston”
Reviews.Author: djGPipe
Reviews.Content: Had a free weekend in early May and decided to check out W Boston for the first time. I was immediately impressed with the overall ambience, and decor, of the hotel. The doormen were very nice, each one looked us in the eye and welcomed us to the hotel. Although we entered the lobby soaking wet from the rain, we were greeted by Noah, who was particularly helpful--offering us towels to dry off. He also made some great suggestions of nearby places to check out, and told us all about W Lounge. If you get a chance, definitely spend a late afternoon at W Lounge--the Mojito's are legit.

Reviews.Title: “A bit too trendy for me - I left unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: PerfectJourneys
Reviews.Content: I would like to begin by saying that overall the hotel is a very nice hotel and while there is nothing wrong with it, I did not find it a good fit for me personally. I was attending meetings there, otherwise I would not have chosen this hotel. I spend a lot of time in hotels and this was my first stay at a "W". There were a couple of hiccups at check-in, but nothing too serious. The rooms are spacious and the bed was comfortable. The chairs in the room however, were not. I don't know who thought that corner chairs with no backs would be a good choice for relaxing in a hotel room. They were incredibly uncomfortable and the only other option was the desk chair or sitting on the bed. Neither of which was particularly appealing for watching television. Speaking of television, I was surprised that the lovely flat screen TV mounted on the wall had no ability to turn or swivel, even a couple of inches. The television faces the bed, period. Don't plan on being able to really view it well from the uncomfortable chairs. While I applaud the attempt to be "green" by choosing energy efficient lighting, I found myself struggling to see in the bathroom mirror. The lighting was only on one side of the sink and was ineffectual at best. Add to that the fact that the mirror was at the back of a rather deep counter and any man wanting a shave or any woman wanting to apply mascara would have a pretty difficult time seeing in order to do so. (I overheard some others in my group voicing this very same complaint.) While I would probably not stay at a "W" again, as I mentioned in the beginning, it really is about personal preference in hotel style and comfort. I would rather they get rid of the chrome knick knack kaleidoscope and give me comfy chair to rest in at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Eatsbonbons
Reviews.Content: New, very contemporary hotel. The service was great--everyone very pleasant. The room was huge and beautiful--very cool. We got a great online rate, much lower than the regular rate, so it was definitely worth it. We were in town for a show at the Wilbur Theater, which is right across the street, and there are many restaurants and bars within the surrounding blocks, so it was perfect! Only complaint was that since we were on a lower floor facing Stuart Street, we could hear a lot of street noise and partying late at night when the bars closed. Other than that, I wouldn't change a thing and would highly recommend the W Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: JimTexas47
Reviews.Content: Overpriced but quite comfortable hotel in the heart of the city

Reviews.Title: “W Boston - Go In Style....”
Reviews.Author: suitcasengo
Reviews.Content: I have done extensive traveling and this was my first time staying at a W property. I was warmly greeted at the door and the associates were friendly but not invasive on personal space. The W Boston was trendy, hip, cool, and had some impressionable touch points ( ex. flavored waters, vitamins to stay healthy, eclectic lounge, unique decor, personal service with front desk agents, "weather/info" station etc). The room we stayed it was spacious enough, space to work and very clean. The next morning upon checkout, I was assisted by a polished associate named Laura (G). Her outgoing personality and professional manner is the epitome of what hospitality should be. She went above and beyond to ensure that I had a fantastic last impression of the W. And so I write my review on here.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever, Whenever!”
Reviews.Author: jolisart
Reviews.Content: I do business a great deal in the Boston area, but I'd never really stayed in the city, nor experienced any nightlife, so I thought during my last trip, I would tack on a night and cash in some Starwood Lodging points. I picked the W based on the reputation I'd heard elsewhere about their personalized service and modern rooms. I was not disappointed. I had reserved a regular corner room, and when we arrived, we had been upgraded to one of two WOW corner suites in the hotel. WOW is right! The room, or rooms, were immaculate, clean, modern, with every convenience you could imagine. The room, for lack of a better description, was decadent! A complete luxury. What was even MORE impressive was the service, however. The W hotels have the reputation for making every wish come true, "so long as it's legal." This is so true! If they don't have what you want on the menu, they get it from another place. If you wish to have a Dt. Mountain Dew, or Starbucks, or whatever, on your doorstep at a specific time, it is there. Whatever you wish. And what I found was, in some cases, at no extra charge. Surprise! And they have a guest database which keeps track of your wishes, so if I were to stay with them again, my Dt. Mt. Dew would simply arrive at 7am. Wow! There is a HUGE amount of attention to detail from the staff, from switching out welcome floor mats in elevators according to the time of day, to having a PERSONAL wake up call (remember those days?) with a cheery voice reminding you to take your umbrella with you if it's a rainy day. Overall, I now know, after staying just once, that I would choose this luxury brand over any other going forward. I was that impressed. On other notes, the location was great....within walking distance to many sites, and the club downstairs seemed to be THE place to be in the evenings. And despite the "hotness" of the location and hotel, it is without a doubt one of the most quiet I've been in recently. WOW!

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: melbourne1103
Reviews.Content: Staff where rude and brash, room had a former customers sneeze residue over the wall of a corner room AND THE NOISE IN THE MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT ON A FRIDAY/SAT NIGHT will make you want to move to another hotel for some peace and quite!! Sadly the whole stay in the hotel was very dissapointing especially as it is only 6mths old. The one thing worth checking out is the front bar, just stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel great; Room service, much to be desired.”
Reviews.Author: harmonyeternal
Reviews.Content: After a 17 hour flight from Japan, I wanted rest and peace. My stay was very comfortable down to the bath gel, an aromatic sage citrus. Concierge was the BEST, always providing useful information for shows and how to get around. Nice edgy crowd in the evenings at the bar/hotel desk. Getting around Boston is a snap with the tram 5 minutes walk away. I had one small issue with room service. Ordered one thing, ended up with something else. When I initially asked to have what I had not ordered removed from my bill, I thought the matter was closed. It was messy and not worth writing more about, but it was frustrating that I made three trips to the desk to address the matter. All in all, definitely more positives than negatives. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great and friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: junellemarie
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to send a quick thank you to all the staff at the W hotel in Boston. A group of 8 of us girls came down to watch a few of them run in the marathon a couple weeks ago. We had great service at the hotel. All your staff were super friendly and helpful. Noah Derstien was very pleasant and helpful in setting us up at a few nightclubs and with ideas of things to see and places to go. He was always smiling and cheeerful. Brittany, I believe that is her name, was also very friendly and helpful when we were in the hotel boutique. I will recommend to all my friends to stay at the W hotel in Boston when traveling there. We are looking forward to our next stay in the future. Regards, Junelle Grindberg

Reviews.Title: “One of our best ever hotel experiences”
Reviews.Author: MHKinMDI
Reviews.Content: As sent to hotel management following our stay: Hi, Just wanted to drop you a quick note to let you know much we enjoyed our recent stay. My wife and I travel a lot and have stayed at any number of top-end hotels (and many, many other Ws); our stay in Boston over the Marathon weekend was among the most enjoyable hotel experiences we've ever had. Kudos to the staff, all of whom were helpful, pleasant and professional. Also thanks much for the special efforts shown to runners -- right down to the crown in our room on our return. Again, exceptional stuff, well done. And thanks,

Reviews.Title: “Whatever, Whenever??? seems to be $$$$”
Reviews.Author: CJConnor
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for the weekend of the Boston marathon. First impression was, "Wow" very modern, contemporary. Unfortunately, the rooms were very small, lighting was kinda cool, but not practical. The light switches were that you had to turn on the main lights in order for the bathroom lights to work. In the middle of the night, this isn't good! Then the cleaning service was not up to par. We were out most of the day on Saturday, only to come back to an unkept room at 5:30pm. I needed to make sure this would not happen the following Marathon day, as I was running in it and had scheduled a massage. I called the front desk and they answer the phone, "Whatever/Whenever" (must be their motto/slogan!) and they reassured me that we would be first on their list to be serviced. Again it was the same scenario. I was in dire need of a shower but had to wait until they cleaned my room until it was cleaned at 4:30pm. Even then, they only made up the bed, nothing else. For the money paid, this was terrible! They also claimed to have a pool when I booked. Not the case! No bathtub for a post marathon soak, no coffee makers in room or complimentary tea either! Fitness center was just adequate, nothing to write home about. Music "Techno" in lounge area is okay at night time, but not all day long. Not sure if W is trying to go for the 20 something crowd? Jazz or something a little softer during the day would be better. Would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: BulawayoZimtraveller
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by other, negative reviews. I was concerned about the reviews, but the reality was very different. The hotel is comfortable and very well situated near Boston Common, but the best thing about it is the staff, who without exception are exceptionally professional, friendly and helpful. On the one occasion that I had a problem with a broken curtain in my room, it was fixed literally within minutes. I did not notice any loud street noise, even on a Friday night, and I slept very soundly. I shall certainly return to the W in the future.

Reviews.Title: “W lives up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanKelly
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W for weekend girls trip. The hotel is beautiful, posh, and chic. The lobby bar was beautiful and evidently the place to be seen that weekend. There was a line around the block to get into the hotel bar that Saturday night. The hotel is very contemporary and city chic sexy! Beware of sharing a room with someone you are not completly comfortable with. The bathroom is very open, glass shower, and see-through screen from the sink to the bed area. The bathroom can be closed off somewhat, so not a huge issue. Service was excellent! I would recommend a stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All Flash and Little Function. Good location but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: EZOpen
Reviews.Content: Frequent Traveller stayed with family for Boston Marathon. The hotel could be defined as chic or posh, but the more you stay, the closer it comes to being strange. From purple walls, to weird layout of the rooms (including an open bathroom), small lobby, no clear entrance, etc.. the place just feels strange. The rooms are average size, the beds are typically comfortable and the amenities (ipod radio, charging station, flat screen TV) are nice. The location is also very nice. Summary - nice hotel with weird features and overpriced. They seem to be trying too hard to be something they aren't.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest room of all the w hotels i have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: malibumomof7
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, above the usual w standard. Very large rooms. Oddly, bathroom is open to bedroom and we had to get bellman to add a curtain as we shared our room with our teenagers. great products, all the things you expect from a w

Reviews.Title: “Trying too hard to be European trendy”
Reviews.Author: HumbleHobbits
Reviews.Content: A hotel in downtown Boston that insists on calling elevators "lifts" and bathrooms "WCs" set me on edge right from the start; an immediate dose of artificiality. The check-in layout is ill-conceived as people crowd into the only walking space spanning the lobby. Granted, they have some serious space issues to deal with given their location so this can probably be explained away. I did enjoy the fresh flowers in the lobby area - very nice. The staff was friendly in every way - the doormen and valet people were ready with directions or recommendations for things to do. The biggest complaint is the layout of the rooms. Lots of wasted space in an effort to be Euro chic. The lighting was horrible. The only switch near the bed is for a little reading light. To reach a lamp or room light you have to get up and go all the way across the room - not very convenient or well planned. The bathroom, excuse me, WC vanity light is not overhead the mirrror but is slanted directly across the face leaving half your face in complete shadow. Just plain silly. The bed was comfortable and clean - so it rates an average overall. I won't go back if I'm booking my own hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely noisy room”
Reviews.Author: SigisB
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an upscale room (Suite Studio)... The room itself is ackwardly designed (had trouble storing my clothes). The noise from the street went directly into the room. Very dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Dark Rooms, Rude Staff, Tons of Street Noise - What More Do You Need?”
Reviews.Author: TheConsigliere
Reviews.Content: I was so excited a W was opening in Boston and so disappointed by what I found. The rooms are dark and have tons of street noise and noise from the club. They are also poorly laid out. Note to designers - if you put the TV lower than the bed, people can't watch it when they are laying down. It should be higher than the bed. The staff borders on rude - and I grew up in Boston and NY - this goes beyond just being the people are in the city. The staff all but accused me of lying, was completely unapologetic for their own mistakes, routinely said no manager was on duty (maybe that explains part of the problems) and were never able to get a manager to get in touch with me. The restaurant seems amazing, but pricey, even for what it is, and the bar is very cool, in true W fashion. Go visit the bar or restaurant if you want, but stay overnight at a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A FANTASTIC HOTEL IN A GREAT LOCATION FOR SIGHTSEEING”
Reviews.Author: jillysue
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the W. It is in a great location for sightseeing. The room was large, very comfortable and very clean. The staff were very friendly and made everything easy, bags out of the car, car whisked away as there is only small pull-in space at the front.Check-in was quick and easy, no spending ages tapping away at the computer as if no one knew you were coming. A special mention must go to Noah, bags up to the room instantly, coffee maker obtained quickly and on our leaving car sorted without any hassle just a big smile.

Reviews.Title: “The W :)”
Reviews.Author: Opie303
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting to stay at a W hotel for a long time. I finally stayed on Feb 8-10 2010 and was NOT disappointed! I loved this hotel. The location is perfect. Very close to the Charles Play House, China Town and The Melting Pot. One day we even walked to the Boston Commons and over to Faneuil hall. They let us check in very early which was awesome. I think we got into the room around 12:30pm. At first they did say that the inclusions to our package would be brought to the room within 20 minutes and it wasn't but we didnâ€™t really care about that so we left for a few hours and went out to eat and a few other places. Upon returning we expected the inclusions to be in the room and they werenâ€™t. We were a bit disappointed because of the price we paid but once again no big deal. We called the front desk and this time they took care of it right away- which to me is what counts because mistakes do happen (especially in a place as large as this hotelâ€¦.. and its huge!) Other than that everything was perfect! The staff was friendly and very helpful as well as efficient at check in and check out. The valet guys and doormen were friendly with great personalities and we talked to them a few times while we were there. The room was huge with a nice comfy king bed and flat screen TV and shower that was all glass ( I think they called it a peak-a-boo shower or something). The room as well as the hotel, elevators and lobby were spotless. We ordered room service one morning and it was expensive but good and arrived quick. As far as it being loud like other people said, its wasnâ€™t or at least not where I was and my room was located on one of the lower floors and facing the Rock Bottom restaurant and was sort of right above the lobby area and I slept like a baby when we finally arrived back at the hotel. Overall I loved this hotel and would return and tell others to stay also!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the W......but noisy @ night”
Reviews.Author: MarthaL.
Reviews.Content: I really like the look of the W and the room was modern and I like that look. The staff is excellent, especially Leonardo the "door man". Market Restaurant is fantastic. The bummer about the stay is that there are 2 bars nearby and on the Saturday night we stayed we woke up a few times due to the noise on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel, good location, service lacked”
Reviews.Author: bigbirdnyc
Reviews.Content: We have been to the W in New York just for drinks many times and thought we would go to Boston and actually stay at the hotel for a short weekend for the bar, modern amenities and great service. Well, the bar was great, the room was cool and modern(although theTV cable reception was iffy) but the service was not good. We arrived on Saturday at 4:30 and the room wasn't ready. After 4 hours on the road from NYC I was ready to sit on the bed and watch TV. When asked, the front desk couldn't tell us when the room would be ready so we went to the bar for a drink that we had to pay for, no credit for the room not being ready at 3:30 at check-in time. After about 40 minutes I had to go back to the front desk to find the room was ready and she had forgotten to come get us. It was Valentines weekend and everyone seemed very flustered. They told us they would bring the luggage up shortly. An hour later we called down to remind them to bring it up for us so we could go to dinner. It was a last minute truip so we didn't have dinner reservations anywhere. The concierege was too busy (with more imortant guests?) to give us any real attention. He sent us on a wild goose chase for random unspecified restaurants on Nuberry St. in 20 degree weather. The next night he tried to do the same thing until we pressed him for details. We also called down for extra toiletiries which didn't arrive until hours later because we already went out to dinner. The theme seemed to be "we are sorry but we are very busy". If you can't handle capacity something is wrong. The hotel was nice but without good service it is still just a room.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Friendly and Chic”
Reviews.Author: PtownTMW
Reviews.Content: On our first stay at the W Boston, we were warmly and expertly greeted by Lenny at the curb. All the staff, from the curb to the room were friendly and professional. We really enjoyed the beautiful, modern, clean design of the hotel and our our room specifically. The terminology took a day or so to get used to (call "wheels" on your room phone instead of the valet, and find "wired" on the mezzaine level, instead of the business center), but it was cute, so we went with it. They also roll up the floor mats in the public areas mid-day to go from ones which say "good morning" to "good afternoon". It was walking distance to many things like shopping, certainly theatres if you're coming for any show, and easy to get their by car of the highway. I wish that we could have seen better pictures of the rooms from their website, because I might have splurged for the studio suite versus a roomy king room. Just getting square feet measurments from the central reservationist didn't give perspective. Now, the lobby bar is a happening place come 6pm, and the perfect place for drinks with friends before a show or a night out. The cocktail waitresses are smoking hot in their littel black dresses (It's OK, I'm a gay guy), and just lend to the young, hip, sophisticated feel of the place at night. I'm sure we'll be back, because they are opening a spa and a nighclub in the hotel (they opened in Oct '09). I'll probably spring for the suite during a spa weekend when everything is at our finger tips.

Reviews.Title: “Impossible to sleep because of noise”
Reviews.Author: memyselfiee
Reviews.Content: I was on the 12th floor yet the noise from the street was incredible and the room was freezing - maybe the windows haven't been fitted properly. The lighting is ridiculous - bring your own torch for the gloomy beyond words bathroom. Room packed full of rubbish available to buy at inflated prices but bed is very comfortable. The breakfast service in Market is RIDICULOUS. It took 20 minutes to get a menu and then another 45 to get a plate of cold scrambled eggs. The maitre d seemed demented, constantly unavailable and then when found, a little dazed with a strangely spooky fixed smile on his face.Rabid doormen hunt in packs around the entrance yet don't open the door - what's that all about? Food smells invade the lift making it a rather stomach churning experience to go anywhere. Luckily it's only a short walk to Legal Seafoods. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more.”
Reviews.Author: MrSwist
Reviews.Content: I brought my wife to the W for the week of our anniversary. It was perfect. We've stayed at the Park Plaza in the past, but I figured I'd try the W since it was new. It was a great choice. The room was amazing. Super modern, beautiful AND comfortable. There was a huge shower AND a big tub, so while I showered my wife was able to soak in the tub. The rooms were good sized too, much bigger than the W in NY (which cost twice as much). The bed was more comfortable than ours at home, with a nice thick feather bed under very soft sheets. We spent some time in the lounge too, also very modern, a great place for a cocktail (even if you're not staying at the hotel). All of the service staff was excellent and friendly. They know what they're doing. It was quite impressive without being in your face. A perfect balance. It's also in a great location. We took a short walk to Newbury Street and did some shopping, went to Chinatown for some Dim Sum for lunch, very well situated. We even ended up going to a show at the Wang Theater right across the street. We didn't get a chance to eat there, but the menu look incredible . . . next time. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Better Options in Boston”
Reviews.Author: suzyjacuzzi
Reviews.Content: We live in the suburbs of Boston and decided to check into the W for a weekend of fun in the city. Unfortunately, this W Hotel does not live up to all the recent hype or the other W/Starwood properties. Our room was located on the 19th floor and was a bit disappointing. The bathroom area was small with extremely poor lighting and limited counter space (shower was large w/ great water pressure). The desk in the room was loaded with all kinds of "paraphernalia" for purchase - including a bottle of wine, a baseball hat and a bottle of water for $7. Who wants all of that stuff cluttering up the top of the desk?? The room was adequate in size - however, certainly not a room I would want to spend more than 2 nights in. In addition, the outside noise from the streets below was definitely noticeable. We heard the constant buzzing of fire engines, horns and sirens. It's important to know that the hotel lobby turns into a nightclub in the evening with huge lines of W-wannabees waiting outside. The health club was a plus with state of the art equipment and free weights. Overall, it was a pleasant stay ~ however, I will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to a real W Hotel standard.”
Reviews.Author: SandyToesNY
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 5 nights at the W Boston. Having been to W hotels in NY and Hong Kong, I've come to fully understand what makes these hotels unique. This was the only reason why we chose to try out the new W Boston for our stay in Boston. My level of expectation was where it should've been - outstanding service, outstanding attention to detail, outstanding decor and outstanding amenities. As soon as we checked into our room, I was left ill-satisfied on all accounts. I will start off by saying that if comparing the W Boston to other hotel chains like the Sheraton or Hilton, it was a decent hotel. The room itself was very spacious. But I would've traded a smaller space for all the unique qualities that make it worthy of being called a W. If you have stayed at other W Hotels before, the W Boston WILL be a major disappointment. Here is a list of the things that were subpar to a real W's standards: The people that manned the front desk were just simply doing their jobs. They looked up your info, gave you your room key, and that's about it. Didn't crack a smile, didn't want to seem too friendly. The W Hotel's mantra is "Whatever, Whenever". I don't think the front desk got the memo. As soon as we get to our room, my mind started buzzing around noticing all the little things that was missing in the so-called W room. Where were the automatic light buttons by the bedside? (you had to literally get up from bed all the way to the front door to shut the lights off. Boo.) Where were the cool modern gadgets? Where were the cool home furnishings? The decor in this room was very 'corporate' and 'business-man' like, which is FINE if we were staying at a Sheraton. And there was a very strange wall hanging of a haunted forest next to the bed and a weird poem about ravens and birds printed on the inside bathroom wall. Definitely not romantic, and definitely not cool. There were no slippers in the room and no toothbrush kits in the bathroom, so we had to call the front desk for those. They ran those up to our room in lightning speed, but they were supposed to already be in the room! There was something "off" about the down comforter. My husband and I plopped down on the bed after a 6 hour bus ride, and i noticed thousands of tiny little feathers dancing in the air. And everytime we moved the comforter the slightest bit, (even just getting in and out of bed), the air would be filled with tiny feathers. I know that this is not a problem with high quality comforters, since they finished the seams with double and triple reinforcements. I saw the feathers on everything - the black nightstand, our water glasses, our clothes.... We took one look at the room service menu and we knew we would never be ordering food to our room during the stay. If you are on a corporate expense account, knock yourself out. But $28 for 2 eggs and potatoes? No thank you. Also, the Bliss Spa was not opened yet. Major bummer. There should've been a notice about that on the starwood website, but there wasn't. The gym was pretty small but not too many people were there during the hours we were working out, so we had the run of the place. It would've been nice if the gym were on a higher floor so we aren't looking out to a red brick building while we're working out. It's small things like this that make a hotel feel special. Another lost point here. There is free wifi in the Lounge, so we would go there with our laptops in the morning. I was pretty surprised that they didn't have any food/drink service in the morning. They didn't open until noon. So where are we supposed to get our coffee from? The $9 drip coffee from room service? I would've been annoyed if I were on a business trip. But we were not, so we went across the street to Starbucks every morning. The lounge gets packed at night and is very lively. Our key card kept getting deactivated for some reason, and every time we went to the front desk to get it fixed, it was the same woman asking us the same questions. Either she didn't recognize us each time, or she was being an unaccommodating pain. I don't know which is worse. And never offered an apology for our inconvenience. Seriously? Doormen - there were about 4-5 of them standing around the door at all times. But how is it that more than half the time we came in and out of the hotel, we opened those heavy doors by ourselves. More than half! The one really good thing about the W Boston was the location. We found it convenient to everything. Also, the Rock Bottom Bar across the street had a great selection of beers and delicious food. Highly recommended. Next time in Boston, we will stay at the Nine Zero hotel. This W Hotel was a total bust and overall very disappointing. Never again, W Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Dippster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Hotel for 3 nights in December. Main reason for the choice was the good deal we got on the room for booking before it opened in September. We had a lovely corner room with floor to ceiling windows on 2 sides. The room was spacious and as you would expect very modern. The room was equipt with every mobile phone charger on the market, a huge flat screen tv, a lovely double shower, and what has to be the comfiest bed I've ever slept on. The welcome was welcoming, the room was cleaned well every day, the staff tried to be helpful, not sure they were that knowledgable though - i've started to expect the kind of knowledge I get from the TA forums! We ate one day in the restaurant for breakfast, $60 for 2 breakfasts - I didn't really rate it, breakfast is breakfast I don't get the point of trying to make it fancy - half my plate was full of a baby tomato salad and the crispy potatoes were undercooked in the middle. The hotel is well positioned, we were close to Newbury St, the common and Copley Plaza. The main problem with he hotel was the noise, this maybe due to the floor to ceiling windows. Our room was looking over the Comedy Stop which seemed to kick everyone out at the same time...2am, I've never heard a noise like it, we were 10 flrs up too! The Comedy Stop only seems to be on Friday and Saturday night so if your planning to stay durin the week you shouldn't have a problem! All in all we had a good stay at the W. I just wish they had put some Christmas decorations up!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Guiv37
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing, the concierge perfect. The bar and the restaurant were always full with beuatifull and weel dressed people... I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Oops. Not the best choice for me.”
Reviews.Author: opined
Reviews.Content: The W Boston should have been better for me, but it's probably my own fault that it wasn't the right fit. I needed a quality room with a comfortable bed to get a good night's sleep on a weekend, but I wasn't prepared for the noise coming from the bar below and from the traffic and street life. My room was even facing the back of the hotel, and the noise was still intolerable. If you're going to stay here, treat it as a nightclub with an attached hotel. It'll help if you are visiting friends who live in the area so that you don't have to spend your whole time in the hotel. Overall, the whole place was just slightly off. It didn't feel like the designers worked well together to synthesize everything. The space in the room felt confused and maze-like. The quality of the furnishing felt like one step up from Ikea. Entering the hotel was awkward because it is in the middle of the block across from one of the worst lower-level mall/office buildings in the city. With that said, the staff was nice, and I have had worse service at nicer hotels. The room service was nice; the food arrived hot with a friendly attendant. Apart from the noise, the only unsettling part of the overall experience was getting a room that someone before me had obviously come in, sat down, and decided it wasn't right for him. The indentations in the bed and a baggage claim check were proof thereof. I'm not so picky as to request that the room be made up again, but you would at least expect them to check a room that someone else has entered and refused. I think that I would probably choose a stuffier corporate hotel over this one unless I was coming to the city to party for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LIDietitian
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the W last weekend and had a great time. The bar was AMAZING! The rooms were really nice. The service was great- some of the staff even remembered our names the next morning when they saw us in the lobby. I would highly recommend staying there and plan of staying there the next time we go up to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A cynically poor addition to the Starwood portfolio”
Reviews.Author: HOTELTRIANON
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay in the new W Boston and unfortunately the available chic luxe vibe mixed with interesting architecture and room staging and scattering of beautiful people that characterizes some of the more interesting W hotels (Union Square, Chicago, Atlanta Midtown, Seattle, Mexico City) has, not unexpectedly sunk low in the black hole of Boston's theater district. Uncomfortably squashed next to Chinatown, opposite the Rock Bottom Tavern and the seedier streets that lead into South End. The architecture is bland to the extent of looking like the headquarters of a medium size cement distributer. The ground floor is dominated by a lively bar but for hotel guests, we have to squash into an oddly shaped space to wait endlessly while the "Talent" as Ws designate their employees, plod slowly, hitting keys with thick fingers until you are just desperate for any rooms. The normally chic model wannabes have been replaced by pudgy short men who look like mafiosi planted to work as hotel staff. The rooms themselves are large and uninspiring. Gone is the individualism and attempt at international luxe that characterizes more glamorous W locations- replaced by unusable plastic corner seats, sparse furnishing and annoyingly small closet space given the square footage. The same applies to bathroom where the sink and loo are cramped, tip-toeing around a vast useless empty floor. Lighting is abysmal- covering fluorescent light tubes by plexiglass may be cool in a high school plastic arts projects, but in a room dominated by mixed woods and pale sheets, they just look cheap and unflattering, Reading lights appear to be miniature klieglights designed by elves. Service is atrocious- toileteries and water not replaced, dirty towels slung back over chairs, cushions left as they are found and the bed made in the most perfunctory way. Essentially a 30 second wander through by housekeeping- I mean cleaning "Talent"- to engaged in their black outfits to really make up a room. Front of house "Talent" blend seemlessly with the tide of unwashed slovenly humanity piling out of the mass dining establishments that surround the hotel and any sense of ownership or leadership seems utterly lacking. The styling of the rooms and common areas are so generic that they can't make up for the hotel views of not quite the common, not quite the east, not quite the river- rather the late 20th century monstrosities that surround the W Boston. And in this singular lack of charm, style or service- one would have though free WiFi might have been a good selling point. For this blue collar city with the smartest and most creative minds in the world, only honesty or truly intellectual concepts are going to succeed.
